Description: THE GOVERNMENT OF GUAM PURCHASED AN 18-UNIT APARTMENT BUILDING TO BE USED AS A NON-CONGREGATE SHELTER IN ANIGUA, GUAM.  THIS FACILITY IS CURRENTLY UNDER RENOVATION TO ENSURE ADA COMPLIANCE AND THE INSTALLATION OF SUITABLE FIXTURES APPROPRIATE FOR THE DESIGNATED FUNCTION.  THIS FACILITY DOES NOT HAVE A STAND- ALONE EMERGENCY GENERATOR OR WATER TANK.  THE DESTRUCTIVE FORCES OF TYPHOON MAWAR AND THE RESULTING DAMAGE TO POWER AND WATER INFRASTRUCTURE HIGHLIGHTED THE NEED TO HAVE EMERGENCY POWER AND WATER AVAILABLE ON-SITE.  THIS IS NECESSARY TO PROVIDE STABILITY AND THE CONTINUITY OF SERVICES TO AN ALREADY CHALLENGED POPULATION.CURRENTLY THE GOVERNMENT OF GUAM, THROUGH THE USE AND APPLICATION OF COVID TAP FUNDS IS IN THE PROCESS OF ACQUIRING TWO WAREHOUSE FACILITIES NECESSARY TO ADDRESS THE NEEDS OF THE ISLAND TO SUFFICIENTLY RESPOND TO THE COVID PANDEMIC AND OTHER NATURAL AND MAN-MADE DISASTERS.  THE ONE OF THE WAREHOUSES IS CURRENTLY BEING LEASED FOR THE PURPOSES OF STORING THE EQUIPMENT AND SUPPLIES HELD BY THE GUAM HOMELAND SECURITY OFFICE OF CIVIL DEFENSE AS THEIR PRESENT FACILITY UNDERGOES MUCH NEEDED RENOVATION AS AN APPROVED PROJECT IDENTIFIED FOR COVID TAP FUNDING.  A SECURITY SYSTEM THAT INCLUDES CAMERAS AND ALARMS ARE NECESSARY TO SECURE THE FACILITY TO PREVENT THEFT AND LOSS OF EQUIPMENT AND SUPPLIES.  THE FACILITY ALSO REQUIRES THE USE OF A FORKLIFT FOR THE SAFE HANDLING OF MATERIALS.

ASTCA REQUIRES A NEW GIS MAPPING SOFTWARE THAT IS COMPATIBLE WITH ITS NEW MIND BILLING SOFTWARE. ASTCA HAS PARTNERED WITH THE AMERICAN SAMOA DEPARTMENT OF COMMERCE FOR THE TERRITORIAL GEOSPATIAL FRAMEWORK PROJECT, WHICH PROVIDES A COOPERATION AMONG GOVERNMENT DEPARTMENT AND AGENCIES, AND PRIVATE INSTITUTIONS THAT HAVE AN INTEREST IN THE ACQUISITION, SECURE STORAGE, APPLICATION AND DISSEMINATION OF SPATIALLY REFERENCE DATA AND GEOGRAPHIC INFORMATION SYSTEM (GIS) SOFTWARE TO FACILITATE INTERPRETATION, ANALYSIS, AND VISUALIZATION OF GEOSPATIAL CHARACTERISTICS AND INTER-RELATIONS IN AMERICAN SAMOA.

AWARD PURPOSE: WESTCARE PACIFIC ISLANDS RESPECTFULLY REQUESTS CONTINUED SUPPORT FOR ITSCHEBERDIL BELAU CENTER, A YOUTH AND FAMILY RESOURCE CENTER SERVING THE REPUBLIC OF PALAU. THISPROGRAM HAS THREE DISTINCT COMPONENTS: (1) A TUTORING PROGRAM FOR STUDENTS IN GRADES 1-8  (2) APARENTING AND HEALTHY RELATIONSHIPS PROGRAM FOR YOUNG COUPLES AGES 18-30  AND (3) AN OUTREACHCAMPAIGN COMPRISING SOCIAL MEDIA, COMMUNITY PRESENTATIONS, AND COMMUNITY EVENTS.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: THE CHEBERDIL BELAU CENTER SERVES AS A CENTRALIZED POINT OF ACCESS TOSERVICES FOR PALAUS CHILDREN, YOUTH, AND FAMILIES. PROGRAMMING IS DELIVERED DIRECTLY AT THE CENTERTO CONSTITUENTS. THE CENTER ALSO SERVES AS A RESOURCE HUB WHERE INFORMATION ON IMPORTANTCOMMUNITY RESOURCES IS SHARED. THE CENTER BUILDS UPON THE VALUE OF KLAINGESEU, COMMUNITYSUPPORT, WHERE YOUNG PEOPLE HAVE OWNERSHIP AND EFFICACY IN SHAPING THEIR COMMUNITY. THECHEBERDIL BELAU CENTERS PRIMARY ACTIVITIES INCLUDE: (1) TUTORING TO SUPPORT THE ACADEMIC SUCCESSOF STUDENTS IN GRADES 1-8  (2) EDUCATIONAL WORKSHOPS FOR YOUNG ADULTS FOCUSED ON HEALTHYRELATIONSHIPS, ECONOMIC STABILITY, AND POSITIVE PARENTING  AND (3) COMMUNITY OUTREACH.EXPECTED DELIVERABLES OR OUTCOMES: THE SERVICES OFFERED AT THE CHEBERDIL BELAU CENTER AREENTRENCHED IN CULTURE AND TRADITIONS THAT ARE MEANINGFUL TO THE PEOPLE OF PALAU. THE CENTERSSERVICES HELP PARTICIPANTS DEVELOP INCREASED PROSOCIAL BEHAVIORS, IMPROVED INDIVIDUAL WELLBEING,ECONOMIC STABILITY, IMPROVED PARTNER COMMUNICATION AND CONFLICT MANAGEMENT, REDUCED INTIMATEPARTNER VIOLENCE, IMPROVED COMMITMENT TO RELATIONSHIP AND FAMILY, IMPROVED PARENTING SKILLS, ANDACADEMIC SUCCESS.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE PROGRAMS INTENDED BENEFICIARIES ARE PALAU STUDENTS IN GRADES 1-8,HIGH-RISK INDIVIDUALS AND COUPLES AGES 18-30, AND PARENTS OF SCHOOL-AGED CHILDREN.

BUILD THE CAPACITY OF THE PALAU NATIONAL YOUTH COUNCIL (PNYC) TO CREATE A NATIONALREPOSITORY OF YOUTH-RELATED DATA AND RELATED ANALYTICAL REPORTS (I.E., THE NATIONAL YOUTHPROFILE AND WHERE THE JOBS ARE: PALAU) BY COLLECTING, SYNTHESIZING, AND ANALYZING EXTANTWORKFORCE, EMPLOYMENT, AND CENSUS DATA FOR PALAUAN YOUNG PEOPLE (AGES 1835) THAT WILLBE ALIGNED WITH AN ASSESSMENT OF PALAUS WORKFORCE NEEDS (E.G., AVAILABLE JOBOPPORTUNITIES AND CORE KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS REQUIRED FOR PRODUCTIVE EMPLOYMENT INPALAU). THIS PROJECT AND ITS PHASES OF WORK WILL ALSO ALLOW FOR THE MHRCTD TO IDENTIFYSTRENGTHS AND GAPS IN CURRENT WORKFORCE DEVELOPMENT SYSTEMS.

THE FUNDING ASSISTANCE WILL BE USED FOR REMUNERATION OF EXPENSES ASSOCIATED WITH RELIEF AND RECOVERY EFFORTS ON THE ISLAND OF ROTA AS A RESULT OF IMPACTS CAUSED BY TYPHOON MAWAR IN MAY 23, 2023. BIDEN APPROVED THE CNMI  S REQUEST FOR A PRESIDENTIAL EMERGENCY DECLARATION TO FURTHER SUPPORT THE COMMONWEALTH S EMERGENCY RESPONSE TO TYPHOON MAWAR, THUS MOBILIZING FEDERAL RESOURCES TO THE REGION.

RESTORING NATIVE VEGETATION AND MITIGATING ENVIRONMENTAL HAZARDS ON SAND AND CORAL MINED-LANDSCAPES IN AMERICAN SAMOA IS THE CENTRAL FOCUS OF THIS PROJECT. AS AN AVENUE TO REMEDY THE TERRITORY S VULNERABLE SITUATION OF ABANDONED COASTAL LANDSCAPES CAUSED BY CONSTANT MINING, EROSION, FLOODING, RISING SEA-LEVEL, HIGH TIDES, KING AND TIDAL WAVES, SEVERE WEATHER AND CYCLONES, REVEGETATION OF NATIVE PLANTS TREES AS A NATURE-BASED REMEDY IS ESSENTIALLY NEEDED. THE ROOT CAUSE OF MASSIVE COASTAL DAMAGES IS THE INEVITABLE FACT THAT  SAND AND CORAL MINING  BY THE PEOPLE IN VILLAGES FOR BUILDING, AND ROAD CONSTRUCTION PURPOSES, OCCASIONALLY BY THE LOCAL GOVERNMENT, IS UNSTOPPABLE.

THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO IMPROVE GWAS ABILITY TO LOCATE SUBSURFACE WATER LINE LEAKS AND ABILITY TO INSPECT AND CLEAN GWAS WASTEWATER COLLECTOR LINES INCLUDING INACCESSIBLE LINES. THESE GOALS WILL BE ACCOMPLISHED THROUGH CLASSROOM AND FIELD TRAINING. GWA WILL PROCURE TRAINERS RECOMMENDED BY THE MANUFACTURER OF THE RELATED EQUIPMENT TO TRAIN GWA STAFF ON ADVANCED LEAK DETECTION TECHNOLOGY AND SPECIALIZED FACILITY INSPECTION EQUIPMENT. GWA LEAK DETECTION UNIT WILL BE FULLY EQUIPPED WITH UPDATED LEAK DETECTION EQUIPMENT AND MODERN METHODS OF DETECTING SUBSURFACE LEAKS WITHIN THE WATER DISTRIBUTION SYSTEM. THIS ALLOWS FOR A REDUCTION IN UNACCOUNTED FOR WATER, REDUCED MANHOURS FOR WATER LEAK REPAIRS, AND IMPROVED WATER SYSTEM PRESSURES. GWAS WASTEWATER COLLECTIONS TEAM WILL ALSO HAVE NEW AND ADVANCED EQUIPMENT THAT WILL ALLOW FOR A MORE EFFICIENT MEANS OF CLEANING AND INSPECTING SEWER LINES IN INACCESSIBLE OR ENVIRONMENTALLY SENSITIVE AREAS. ADDITIONALLY, GWAS SPECIAL OPS DIVISION WILL HAVE THE ABILITY TO INSPECT CUSTOMER CONNECTION TO IMPROVE GWAS RECORDKEEPING AND DATABASE, IMPROVE ENFORCEMENT OF SEWER CONNECTION REQUIREMENTS, WHILE MINIMIZING SAFETY HAZARDS. NO GRANT FUNDS WILL BE ALLOTTED FOR SUBRECIPIENTS.

THE WATER AND ENVIRONMENTAL RESEARCH INSTITUTE OF THE WESTERN PACIFIC (WERI) AT THE UNIVERSITY OF GUAM (UOG) REQUESTS  199,929 FOR PURCHASING TWO NEW WATER QUALITY INSTRUMENTS, A FLOW INJECTION ANALYZER (FIA) FOR DISSOLVED ION ANALYSES AND A FULLY AUTOMATED BIOLOGICAL OXYGEN DEMAND SYSTEM. THE CURRENT INSTRUMENTS HAVE BEEN IN USE LONG BEYOND THEIR DESIGN LIFE AND HAVE BECOME INOPERATIVE. THESE INSTRUMENTS COVERED OVER 1,000 WATER SAMPLES ANNUALLY. THE WERI WATER QUALITY LAB (WERI LAB) SUPPORTS ONGOING RESEARCH, GRADUATE EDUCATION, REGULATORY COMPLIANCE, AND URGENT COMMUNITY TESTING NEEDS FOR GUAM, THE COMMONWEALTH OF THE NORTHERN MARIANA ISLANDS (CNMI), THE REPUBLIC OF THE MARSHALL ISLANDS, AND THE FEDERATED STATES OF MICRONESIA (FSM). ACQUISITION OF THESE INSTRUMENTS WILL ENABLE THE WERI LAB TO MEET ITS MISSION TO PROVIDE RELIABLE, READILY AVAILABLE, LOW-COST, RAPID-RESPONSE LABORATORY SUPPORT FOR RESEARCH, REGULATORY, AND OTHER WATER-QUALITY MAINTENANCE AND ENVIRONMENTAL ASSESSMENT NEEDS THROUGHOUT THE REGION.

DATA FROM GUAM S MOST RECENT EPIDEMIOLOGICAL PROFILE SHOWS THAT GUAM S MIDDLE AND HIGH SCHOOL STUDENTS HAVE HIRER RATES OF TOBACCO AND ALCOHOL USAGE, AND HIGHER RATES OF FEELINGS OF SADNESS OR HOPELESSNESS COMPARED TO YOUTHS IN THE UNITED STATES. IN THE MOST RECENT YOUTH DATA REPORT FROM THE GUAM EPIDEMIOLOGICAL OUTCOMES WORKGROUP, DATA SHOWS THAT GUAM HIGH SCHOOL STUDENTS HAVE HIGHER RATES OF SUICIDE IDEATION AND ATTEMPTED SUICIDE. IN ALL METIRCS, YOUTH FROM THE FREELY ASSOCIATED STATES AND INDIGENOUS CHAMORU YOUTH HAVE THE HIGHEST RATES OF AT-RISK BEHAVIOR THAT CAN DRASTICALLY ALTER A YOUNG PERSON S FUTURE AND HINDER THEIR POTENTIAL AND SUCCESS. THROUGH THE FANHALE  PROJECT, MANE LU PROPOSES TO DEVELOP STRONG SOCIAL-EMOTIONAL SKILLS, LEADERSHIP SKILLS, COMMUNITY STEWARDSHIP, AND CULTURAL IDENTITY IN AT-RISK YOUTH AGES 9-15 WHO ARE INDIGENOUS CHAMORU AND FROM THE FAS THROUGH INCREASING ACCESS TO CULTURALLY-BASED SOCIAL AND EMOTIONAL (SEL) PROGRAMS. FANHALE  IN GUAMS INDIGENOUS LANGUAGE, CHAMORU, MEANS TO TAKE ROOT. THE FANHALE  PROJECT WILL DEVELOP THESE ROOTS IN YOUTH USING A TWO-PRONGED APPROACH THAT REINFORCES POSITIVE YOUTH DEVELOPMENT IN AND OUT OF SCHOOL.

GUAM COMMUNITY COLLEGE (GCC) NEEDS A NEW 10-SPEED LOW-LOW TRACTOR WITH A 40FT CHASSIS TRAILER AND A TRUCK DRIVING SIMULATOR TO SUPPORT ITS TRUCK DRIVING PROGRAM.THE GOAL OF THIS PROJECT IS TO INCREASE THE NUMBER OF TRUCK DRIVERS IN GUAM. TRUCK DRIVERS ARE CRITICAL TO GUAM S ECONOMY BECAUSE ALMOST ALL CONSUMER GOODS ARE IMPORTED IN 20 AND 40-FOOT CONTAINERS. MOVING THESE CONTAINERS FROM THE SHIPPING PORT TO THEIR DESTINATION REQUIRES TRUCKS WITH QUALIFIED CLASS C LICENSED DRIVERS. THE MOVEMENT OF THESE CONTAINERS SUPPORTS COMMERCE AND CONSTRUCTION.THE DEMAND FOR QUALIFIED DRIVERS IS HIGH. THE LACK IS DRIVERS IS CAUSING SLOWDOWNS IN THE CONSTRUCTION INDUSTRY AND THE RETAIL SECTOR. THE PROJECT IS DESIGNED TO MEET THE EMPLOYERS  NEEDS WITH QUALIFIED TRUCK DRIVERS WITH A CLASS-C CDL LICENSE WHO CAN DRIVE A TRACTOR AND TRAILER. PARTICIPANTS WHO COMPLETE THE PROGRAM WILL HAVE STACKABLE CERTIFICATES THAT WILL ALLOW THEM, IN THE FUTURE, TO BUILD ON THEIR CURRENT QUALIFICATIONS.

THE GUAM OFFICE OF PUBLIC ACCOUNTABILITY (OPA) RESPECTFULLY SUBMITS ITS TRAINING GRANT REQUEST FOR FISCAL YEAR 2023 FOR  76,000. THIS REQUEST INCLUDES AN INITIATIVE WITH THE DEPARTMENT OF THE INTERIOR OFFICE OF INSPECTOR GENERAL (DOI-OIG) FOR INTERNSHIPS AND OTHER CAPACITY BUILDING PROGRAMS FOR OPA. THIS REQUEST IS SIMILAR TO PAST TRAINING GRANTS FUNDED BY THE OFFICE OF INSULAR AFFAIRS (OIA) FOR OPA AND OTHER INSULAR AUDIT OFFICES.THE COOPERATIVE EFFORT BETWEEN OIG, OPA, AND OIA HAS PROVEN TO BE A SUCCESSFUL VENTURE TO BUILD AND IMPROVE AUDITOR CAPACITY AND FURTHER PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT FOR OUR OFFICE. WE CONTINUE TO SEE THE BENEFITS AS OUR AUDITORS HAVE GAINED SKILLS AND KNOWLEDGE WHICH HAS DEVELOPED THE OPAS CAPACITY. THE OPAS PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT GOALS ARE ATTAINED MAINLY THROUGH THE OIA TRAINING GRANT, HELPING US MEET CONTINUING PROFESSIONAL EDUCATION REQUIREMENTS, TRAIN NEW STAFF, DEVELOP EXISTING STAFF, AND NURTURE LEADERSHIP.SINCE 2018, OPA HAS CONTINUOUSLY LOST OVER A DOZEN SENIOR AUDITORS TO AUTONOMOUS AGENCIES, MOST RECENTLY IN 2022. CURRENTLY, EIGHT OF THE 13 CURRENT AUDITORS HAVE AN AVERAGE TENURE WITH OPA OF LESS THAN TWO YEARS, SO THE NEED TO TRAIN AND DEVELOP THESE AUDITORS IS CRITICAL. OPA CONTINUES TO REBUILD ITS OFFICE CAPACITY AND RECRUIT NEW AUDITORS. THERE ARE CURRENTLY NINE AUDIT STAFF THAT ARE ABLE TO TAKE ADVANTAGE OF THE OIG ON THE JOB TRAINING. ALL AUDITORS ARE ABLE TO TAKE ADVANTAGE OF THE EDUCATIONAL TRAINING AND REVIEW COURSES AND GUIDES FOR VARIOUS CERTIFICATIONS.

OUR OVERARCHING GOAL IS TO CREATE LOCAL CAPACITY THAT WILL ENABLE THE US TERRITORY OF GUAM TO DETERMINE IF CONTAMINATED FISH ARE MIGRATING OUT OF AREAS WITH STANDING SEAFOOD CONSUMPTION ADVISORIES AND CONSEQUENTLY BEING CAUGHT BY UNSUSPECTING CITIZENS. TO ACHIEVE THIS, TRAINING WILL BE AN INTEGRAL COMPONENT OF ALL STAGES OF THE PROJECT AND WILL CONSIST OF BOTH FORMAL CLASSROOM INSTRUCTION AND PRACTICAL FIELDWORK. TO ENSURE THAT THIS NEW LOCAL CAPACITY IS PERPETUATED WELL INTO THE FUTURE, OUR TRAINING COHORT WILL BE COMPRISED OF STAKEHOLDERS FROM MULTIPLE SECTORS, INCLUDING ACADEMIC INSTITUTIONS WITH THE CAPACITY FOR SCIENTIFIC RESEARCH, GOVERNMENT AGENCIES ENTRUSTED WITH THE AUTHORITY TO MANAGE OUR NATURAL RESOURCES, AND LOCAL INDUSTRIES AND CITIZENS WHOSE LIVES DEPEND UPON THEIR ACCESS TO THESE RESOURCES.THE TIMING OF THIS INITIATIVE CAPITALIZES ON RECENT ADMINISTRATIVE EFFORTS TO REBRAND THE GUAM DEPARTMENT OF AGRICULTURE DIVISION OF AQUATIC AND WILDLIFE RESOURCES (DAWR) AS AN AGENCY FOR THE PEOPLE  I.E., ONE THAT MANAGES GUAMS RESOURCES IN WAYS THAT BALANCE THE NEEDS OF CULTURES AND SOCIETIES WITH NEEDS ENVIRONMENTAL HEALTH. WE ENVISION THAT OPERATING WITHIN THE CONTEXT OF OUR ISLANDS LONG-HONORED CULTURAL TRADITION OF INAFAMLEK (E.G., COMPASSIONATE AND MEANINGFUL INCLUSION OF EVERYONE INVOLVED AND RESPECTING OPPOSING OPINIONS) WILL RESULT IN A RECIPROCAL APPRECIATION OF EACH PARTICIPANTS KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND PERSPECTIVES, AND WILL BEGIN TO REPAIR PUBLIC OPINIONS OF DAWRS ROLE IN SOCIETY.AT THE CONCLUSION OF THIS PROJECT, GUAM WILL: I) HAVE AN ESTABLISHED FISH TRACKING ARRAY AND A COLLABORATIVE NETWORK CAPABLE OF MAINTAINING AND OPERATING THE SYSTEM  II) EXPONENTIALLY INCREASE THE NUMBER OF PERSONNEL COLLABORATIVELY WORKING ON SPECIES WITHIN OUR FISHERIES THAT MIGHT ONLY BE HIGH-PRIORITY TO THIS ISLAND  AND III) EMPOWER ITS CITIZENS WITH KNOWLEDGE REGARDING IF, HOW, AND WHY, SOME SPECIES THEY CATCH MAY POTENTIALLY BE UNFIT FOR CONSUMPTION, REGARDLESS OF WHERE THEY ARE CAUGHT. CREATING A COLLABORATIVE ANIMAL TRACKING NETWORK ON GUAM, WHOSE PRIMARY MISSION IS TO FILL DATA-GAPS REGARDING FISHERIES WHICH MIGHT ONLY BE A PRIORITY FOR GUAM, REPRESENTS A UNIQUE OPPORTUNITY FOR THE OFFICE OF INSULAR AFFAIRS TO ADVANCE THEIR MISSION GOAL OF EMPOWERING INSULAR COMMUNITIES BY IMPROVING THE QUALITY OF LIFE THEIR CITIZENS, WHILE SIMULTANEOUSLY PROMOTING EFFICIENT AND EFFECTIVE GOVERNANCE.

THE GUAM BUREAU OF STATISTICS AND PLANS (BSP) IS SUBMITTING A PROJECT PROPOSAL FOR FUNDING CONSIDERATION UNDER THE FISCAL YEAR 2023 TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE PROGRAM (TAP), CFDA 15.875, ECONOMIC, SOCIAL, POLITICAL DEVELOPMENT OF THE TERRITORIES THROUGH THE U.S. DEPARTMENT OF INTERIOR, OFFICE OF INSULAR AFFAIRS, ENTITLED VIDEO SURVEILLANCE SYSTEM TO ENHANCE MONITORING OF EXTERIOR PERIMETERS AT THE GUAM DEPARTMENT OF CORRECTIONS.  THE TOTAL GRANT PROPOSAL AMOUNT IS  126,275.THE FUNDING REQUEST IN THIS PROPOSAL WILL ALLOW FOR THE PURCHASE, INSTALLATION AND MAINTENANCE OF A VIDEO SURVEILLANCE SYSTEM TO MONITOR THE ENTIRE EXTERIOR PERIMETERS AND SURROUNDING AREAS OF THE GUAM DEPARTMENT OF CORRECTIONS FACILITIES. AS THE LEAD AGENCY MANDATED TO PROTECT THE PUBLIC BY MAINTAINING CUSTODY AND CONTROL OF ADJUDICATED ADULT LAW OFFENDERS, THE DEPARTMENT OF CORRECTIONS IS LOOKING AT WAYS TO PROTECT AND SERVE THE COMMUNITY AND PROVIDE THE SECURITY, SAFETY AND ACCOUNTABILITY TO THOSE UNDER ITS CARE. FOR TOO LONG THE SEVERE LACK OF SECURITY PERSONNEL HAS NEGATIVELY IMPACTED DOCS ABILITY TO PROVIDE ADEQUATE SUPERVISION AND MONITORING OF INMATES AND STAFF BOTH INSIDE AND OUTSIDE OF THE PRISON FACILITY. TO COMPOUND MATTERS FURTHER, DOC DOES NOT HAVE A SURVEILLANCE SYSTEM TO MONITOR AND SECURE EXTERIOR PERIMETERS AND SURROUNDING AREAS OF THE FACILITY AND, AS A RESULT, HAS CONTRIBUTED TO A GROWING NUMBER OF ILLEGAL AND SUSPICIOUS ACTIVITIES TAKING PLACE SUCH AS ESCAPE ATTEMPTS, ILLEGAL CONTRABAND, FIGHTS AND INMATE AND OFFICER ATTACKS. BOTH THE LACK OF MANPOWER AND THE LACK OF A SURVEILLANCE SYSTEM HAS MADE IT INCREASINGLY DIFFICULT FOR DOC TO MEET ITS MANDATE OF PROVIDING SAFETY, SECURITY AND PROTECTION. THE IMPLEMENTATION OF A VIDEO SURVEILLANCE SYSTEM AT DOC WILL BE AN INVALUABLE TOOL IN IMPROVING SECURITY OPERATIONS AT THE FACILITY AND THE LEVEL OF CONTROL THAT OFFICERS HAVE OVER THEIR ENVIRONMENT, AND THE LEVEL OF SUPERVISION THAT THEY WILL HAVE OVER PRISONERS.THIS PROPOSED PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE FOLLOWING TAP PRIORITIES  PUBLIC SAFETY EMERGENCIES, DISASTER PLANNING AND CAPACITY BUILDING. THE VIDEO SURVEILLANCE SYSTEM WILL BE PROCURED THROUGH THE GOVERNMENT OF GUAM PROCUREMENT PROCEDURES THROUGH AN INVITATION FOR BID AND FOLLOWING THE 2 CFR 200 REQUIREMENTS.AS THE GUAM DEPARTMENT OF CORRECTIONS TRANSCENDS INTO THE 21ST CENTURY, THEY ARE EXPECTED TO ASSESS, ADAPT AND ADDRESS THE COMMUNITYS NEED FOR IMPROVED SERVICES IN SECURITY OPERATIONS AND DEVELOP PLANS AND PROGRAMS THAT WILL EFFICIENTLY AND EFFECTIVELY MEET THOSE REQUIREMENTS. THE USE OF SURVEILLANCE SYSTEMS EQUIPPED TO MONITOR EXTERIOR PERIMETER ENVIRONMENTS OF THE PRISON FACILITY MEETS ONE OF THOSE REQUIREMENTS. WITH A COMPREHENSIVE SURVEILLANCE SYSTEM, AND OTHER ADVANCED FEATURES DESIGNED TO CONTINUOUSLY RECORD ACTIVELY 365 24 7 WITH CLEAR FOOTAGE, EVEN IN CHALLENGING CONDITIONS, INCLUDING COMPLETE DARKNESS, WILL BE AN INVALUABLE RESOURCE FOR THE GUAM DEPARTMENT OF CORRECTIONS IN HOW THEY RESPOND TO A WIDE RANGE OF SITUATIONAL INCIDENTS AND IN HELPING TO KEEP THE PUBLIC SAFE.

THE GOVERNMENT OF GUAM OFFICE OF TECHNOLOGY (OTECH) REQUESTS TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE TO INCREASE THE GOVGUAM NETWORK CYBERSECURITY THROUGH UPGRADED NETWORK EQUIPMENT, ENHANCING WIRELESS SECURITY TOWARD A ZERO TRUST FRAMEWORK, AND DEPLOYMENT OF AN ADVANCED NETWORK VULNERABILITY SCANNING TOOL. THE TOTAL GRANT PROPOSAL REQUEST IS  500,000.00.AS CYBERSECURITY REMAINS ONE OF THE TOP PRIORITIES OF THE GOVERNMENT OF GUAM, IT IS IMPERATIVE THAT OTECH PROTECT THE GOVERNMENT OF GUAMS CYBER INFRASTRUCTURE. OTECH IS CHARGED WITH PROVIDING OVERSIGHT ON ALL INFORMATION TECHNOLOGY RESOURCE MANAGEMENT, POLICIES, STANDARDS, AND GUIDELINES AS WELL AS PROVIDING DIRECT IT SUPPORT SERVICES FOR 40 EXECUTIVE BRANCH AGENCIES, BOARDS AND COMMISSIONS WITH 3,500 GOVERNMENT EMPLOYEES.CURRENTLY, OTECH PARTICIPATES IN THE MULTI-STATE INFORMATION SHARING AND ANALYSIS CENTER (MS-ISAC) AND MAINTAINS SECURITY POLICIES ALIGNING WITH NIST AND CIS CONTROLS. TO THE PRESENT DAY, THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC HAS IMPACTED THE SUPPLY OF MICROCHIP-BASED TECHNOLOGY, AND OTECH MUST CONTINUALLY BALANCE THE CITIZEN NEED FOR ONLINE ACCESS TO GOVERNMENT SERVICES VERSUS THE GOVERNMENT NEED FOR SECURITY. UNDER THIS GRANT PROPOSAL, OTECH REQUESTS TO IMPLEMENT THE FOLLOWING:1. DEPLOY AN ADVANCED NETWORK VULNERABILITY SCANNING TOOL FOR BETTER PROTECTION AND ALIGNMENT WITH THE REQUIREMENT TO PROTECT SENSITIVE PERSONALLY IDENTIFIABLE AND HEALTH INFORMATION.2. UPGRADE CORE GOVGUAM WIDE AREA NETWORK (GGWAN) EQUIPMENT TO MAINTAIN SECURITY.3. IMPLEMENT ENHANCED WIRELESS SECURITY ACROSS GOVGUAM AGENCIES.THE PROPOSED OTECH CYBERSECURITY RESILIENCE PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE FOLLOWING TAP-2023 PRIORITIES: HEALTH IT SYSTEMS, PUBLIC SAFETY EMERGENCIES, MANAGEMENT CONTROL INITIATIVES, DISASTER PLANNING, AND INFORMATION TECHNOLOGY.

WITH THIS GRANT PROPOSAL, GPA IS SEEKING FUNDING FOR PERSONNEL COSTS FOR AN ADDITIONAL 12 MONTHS AFTER THE FUNDS FROM THE FIRST EXTENSION ( 70,000 RECEIVED IN AUGUST 2022) HAVE BEEN EXHAUSTED.  THIS WILL ALLOW FOR CONTINUED BROWN TREE SNAKE-RELATED DATA AND SPECIMEN COLLECTION TO BE SHARED WITH USGS. THE PERSONNEL COST REQUESTED WILL COVER THE SALARY OF THE PERSON HIRED TO ACT AS THE LIAISON BETWEEN USGS AND GPA AND TO CONTINUE TO GATHER SNAKE-CAUSED OUTAGE DATA.  THIS PROPOSAL ALSO REQUESTS TO PURCHASE 10 ADDITIONAL MOTION-SENSING GAME CAMERAS. GPA HAS IDENTIFIED ADDITIONAL AREAS THAT HAVE HAD MULTIPLE OUTAGES CAUSED BY THE BROWN TREE SNAKE AND WOULD LIKE TO GATHER FOOTAGE FROM THESE AREAS. THE SNAKES HAVE BEEN ELUSIVE BUT WITH THE ADDITIONAL CAMERAS WE HOPE TO INCREASE THE LIKELIHOOD OF CAPTURING SOME FOOTAGE OF THE BROWN TREE SNAKE CLIMBING POWER POLES OR GAINING ACCESS TO POWER LINES.NO HARD CONCLUSIONS HAVE BEEN MADE FROM THE DATA COLLECTED TO DATE BUT THERE ARE MORE QUESTIONS AS TO WHY WE ARE STILL HAVING SNAKE-RELATED OUTAGES.  BOTH GPA AND USGS HAVE AGREED TO EXPAND THE DATA COLLECTION TO INCLUDE WEATHER CONDITIONS (RAINY, HUMID, DRY, ETC.), ENVIRONMENTAL CONDITIONS (NEAR VEGETATION, FOOD SOURCES IN THE AREA, ISOLATED AREA, ETC.), AND OTHER POTENTIAL REASONS WHY SNAKES WOULD BE IN THAT PARTICULAR AREA.    USGS AGREES TO CONTINUE TO REVIEW AND ANALYZE THE DATA PROVIDED BY GPA AND PROVIDE INSIGHTS, SHARE FINDINGS, AND PROPOSE PROJECTS WITH POTENTIAL TO MAKE THE POWER INFRASTRUCTURE MORE RESISTANT TO SNAKE ACCESS.  USGS PROPOSES TO EXPLORE THE DATA PROVIDED BY GPA BY RUNNING A MODEL SELECTION ANALYSIS TO IDENTIFY THE FACTORS MOST FREQUENTLY ASSOCIATED WITH OUTAGES. THIS APPROACH WILL ENABLE USGS TO IDENTIFY BROAD SPATIOTEMPORAL PATTERNS AND POTENTIALLY SPECIFIC VULNERABILITIES. THIS INFORMATION CAN THEN BE USED BY GPA TO ALLOCATE RESOURCES TO MINIMIZE NEGATIVE EFFECTS FROM BTS WHERE THEIR IMPACT WILL BE GREATEST. BUILDING ON THESE FINDINGS, USGS CAN ALSO USE THIS INFORMATION TO DESIGN EXPERIMENTS TO BETTER UNDERSTAND HOW BTS ACCESS SENSITIVE UTILITY AREAS AND IDENTIFY REASONS OR CAUSES THAT ATTRACT THE BTS TO THESE PARTICULAR AREAS.

THE PURPOSE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO SUPPORT THE KONTRA I KULEPBLA - CHALLENGE THE SNAKE , OR KIK, THROUGH THE PURCHASE OF A VEHICLE TO ALLOW THE PROJECT TO CONTINUE. THE KIK PROJECT IS AN AWARENESS CAMPAIGN DESIGNED TO INSPIRE BEHAVIOR CHANGE IN SUPPORT OF BTS POPULATION SUPPRESSION PROJECTS ON GUAM. INITIALLY DEVELOPED IN 2011, KIK FOLLOWS OTHER SUCCESSFUL WILDLIFE AWARENESS CAMPAIGNS, SUCH AS GO NATIVE AND KOKO FOR COCOS, PROMOTING GUAMS NATIVE SPECIES RECOVERY TO GENERAL AUDIENCES. THE KIK CAMPAIGN INTRODUCES INFORMATION ABOUT THE IMPORTANCE OF PROTECTING NATIVE BIRDS AND THEIR HABITAT AGAINST INVASIVE SPECIES, ESPECIALLY BTS, THROUGH FUN HANDS-ON ACTIVITIES TO MULTIPLE TARGET AUDIENCES. THESE TARGET AUDIENCES WERE SELECTED BASED ON THEIR ABILITY TO INFLUENCE ISLAND-WIDE SUPPORT OF BTS POPULATION SUPPRESSION PROJECTS: YOUTH, LANDOWNERS, MAYORS, PROFESSIONALS, CHAMORU GROUPS, AND THE GENERAL COMMUNITY. THE KIK CAMPAIGN INTEGRATES THE IMPORTANCE OF BTS CONTROL AND NATIVE BIRD RECOVERY EFFORTS BY SHOWCASING A TAME, EDUCATION KOKO BIRD TO DEVELOP A FONDNESS FOR GUAMS NATIVE WILDLIFE, AND REMIND GUAM OF WHAT WAS LOST AND CAN BE RECOVERED.THE KIK CAMPAIGN IS IN NEED OF A NEW VEHICLE TO TRANSPORT PEOPLE AND ANIMALS TO EVENTS, AS WELL AS TOW A BOAT TO THE SOUTHERN END OF GUAM IN SUPPORT OF ERADICATING SNAKES ON COCOS ISLAND. IN ADDITION THIS PROJECT WILL PROVIDE STAFF TIME FOR DAWR PERSONNEL TO PARTICIPATE IN BTS TECHNICAL WORKING GROUP AND THE ASSOCIATED SUBCOMMITTEES. THE DAWR IS AN INTEGRAL PARTNER TO CONTROL AND ERADICATION OF SNAKES ON COCOS ISLAND AND OTHER AREAS ON GUAM. THE CONTINUATION OF THE KIK CAMPAIGN WILL GARNER SUPPORT FOR SNAKE CONTROL TOOLS ACROSS BROAD LANDSCAPES AND ENCOURAGE GUAMANIANS TO PARTICIPATE IN THE PROCESS.

IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE COMMONWEALTH PLANT AND ANIMAL QUARANTINEACT AND THE ANIMAL HEALTH PROTECTION AND DISEASE CONTROL ACT OF THE NORTHERN MARIANA ISLANDS, THE BROWN TREE SNAKE PROGRAM WORKS TO PREVENT THE ENTRY AND ESTABLISHMENT OF BROWN TREE SNAKES ON SAIPAN, TINIAN, AND ROTA. TO ACCOMPLISH THIS GOAL, THE PROGRAM CONDUCTS INSPECTIONS, TRAPPING, AND RAPID RESPONSE SEARCHES IN THE EVENT OF A SNAKE SIGHTING.

CONTINUING THE HAWAII BROWN TREESNAKE (BTS) INTERDICTION, DETECTOR DOG AND RAPID RESPONSE PROJECT IS CRITICAL FOR PROVIDING A COMPREHENSIVE AND COORDINATED EFFORT TO PREVENT THE INTRODUCTION OF BTS INTO THE STATE OF HAWAII. THE MAINTENANCE OF THE FOLLOWING THREE PROGRAMS WITHIN THE HAWAII DEPARTMENT OF AGRICULTURE (HDOA) PLANT QUARANTINE BRANCH (PQB): 1) THE HAWAII DETECTOR DOG PROGRAM (HDDP), 2) THE BTS SURVEY AND MONITORING PROGRAM, AND 3) THE BTS RAPID RESPONSE PROGRAM, ARE VITAL TO ENSURING THAT BTS DO NOT ENTER OR BECOME ESTABLISHED IN THE STATE. EACH PROGRAM HAS SEPARATE OPERATIONAL ACTIVITIES, BUT ALL WORK IN CONJUNCTION TO ACHIEVE THE GOAL OF MAINTAINING AN INTEGRATED AND MULTI-FACETED APPROACH TO PREVENT THE INTRODUCTION AND ESTABLISHMENT OF BTS IN THE STATE OF HAWAII.

A HARBOR PILOT IS ESSENTIAL TO ESCORTING CARGO VESSELS INTO PAGO PAGO HARBOR. WITHOUT A HARBOR PILOT, CARGO VESSELS CONTAINING THE ESSENTIALS NEEDED IN OUR COMMUNITY WOULDNT BE ABLE TO SAFELY ENTER PAGO PAGO HARBOR. IF THIS SHOULD EVER HAPPEN, THE ESSENTIALS NEEDED FOR THE COMMUNITY WOULDNT FLOW FREELY AND THE COMMUNITY INFRASTRUCTURE WOULD COLLAPSE. ASG CURRENTLY HAS 2 ACTIVE PILOTS AND ONLY 2 CAPABLE PERSONS THAT CAN KNOWLEDGEABLY COMMUNICATE VIA RADIO WITH INCOMING VESSELS OF ANY TYPE. WITH THE AVERAGE PILOTED MOVEMENTS WITHIN THE HARBOR BEING 28 PER MONTH, AND AVERAGE INBOUND AND OUTBOUND VESSELS OF JUST UNDER 60 PER MONTH, AND IN HARBOR MOVES OF MOTOR VESSELS IS 112 PER MONTH, THAT IS A TOTAL OF 150 AVERAGE MOVEMENTS PER MONTH. THIS IS AN EXTREME BURDEN ON THE PILOTS ON INBOUND, OUTBOUND MANEUVERS AS WELL AS RADIO COMMUNICATION FOR UNASSISTED MOVES. WE ARE ASKING FOR ASSISTANCE TO HELP TRAIN MORE HARBOR PILOTS TO SERVE OUR COMMUNITY AND ENSURE THAT THE LIFELINE TO OUTSIDE GOODS AND IMPORTS ARE SUSTAINED AND MAINTAINED FOR THE FUTURE HEALTH OF THE PEOPLE AND ECONOMY OF AMERICAN SAMOA.

RIVER FLOODING AND FLASH FLOODS ARE A MAJOR CONCERN FOR GUAMS SOUTHERN COMMUNITY. THE U.S. TERRITORY OF GUAM IS THE SOUTHERNMOST AND LARGEST ISLAND IN THE MARIANAS CHAIN AND LIES 132830 N LATITUDE AND 1444509 E LONGITUDE. THE ISLAND IS VULNERABLE TO HAZARDOUS FLOODS FROM TROPICAL STORMS AND TYPHOONS WHICH FREQUENT THE ISLAND. THESE MAJOR TROPICAL DISTURBANCES MAY OCCUR THROUGHOUT THE YEAR BUT ARE MOST PREVALENT DURING THE RAINY SEASON WITH THE GREATEST PROBABILITY IN THE MONTHS OF OCTOBER AND NOVEMBER. THE SOUTHERN REGION OF THE ISLAND EXPERIENCES HEAVY FLOODING DUE TO ITS GEOLOGICAL MAKEUP OF TWO DISTINCT VOLCANIC ROCK FORMATIONS. HEAVY RAINFALL RESULTS IN FLOOD WATERS ENTERING OVERBANK AREAS AND RESIDENTIAL PROPERTIES IN THE SOUTHERN VILLAGES. IN ADDITION, THE SOILS IN THIS REGION HAVE SLOW PERMEABILITY WHICH RESULTS IN RAPID RUNOFF THAT CARRIES EROSION DEPOSITS INTO THE BAY AND IMPACTS SHORELINES.TWO PROJECTS ARE PROPOSED TO REDUCE RISKS AND IMPROVE A SOLID FOUNDATION FOR FLOOD RESILIENCE. THE UMATAC RIVER MAINTENANCE AND BANK STABILIZATION AND THE AMO RIVER FLOOD CONTROL AND BANK STABILIZATION PROJECTS WILL ADDRESS FLOODING HAZARDS IN THE SOUTHERN VILLAGES OF SANTA RITA, AGAT, AND UMATAC VILLAGES. THE MITIGATION APPROACH IS INTENDED TO STABILIZE RIVERBANKS, IMPROVE QUALITY OF LIFE, REDUCE SOIL EROSION CAUSED BY STORMWATER RUNOFF, AND BENEFIT CORAL REEFS BY REDUCING SEDIMENTATION. THE FIRST PRIORITY PROJECT, ENTITLED UMATAC RIVER MAINTENANCE AND BANK STABILIZATION WILL ADDRESS IMPACTS OF HAZARDOUS FLOODING TO THE PROJECT AREA BY CONDUCTING REGULAR PRE-STORM CLEANING MAINTENANCE BY REMOVING SEDIMENT SHOALS UNDER AND NEAR THE UMATAC BRIDGE. THIS ACTIVITY WILL INCREASE THE RIVER CHANNEL S ABILITY TO CONVEY FLOODWATERS AND REDUCE THE BRIDGE S RISK OF OVERTOPPING. THE DREDGE MATERIAL COLLECTED WILL BE RE-PURPOSED AS RIP RAP IN GEOTEXTILE BAGS AND INSTALLED FURTHER UP THE RIVER. THE SECOND PRIORITY PROJECT, ENTITLED AMO RIVER FLOOD CONTROL AND BANK STABILIZATION WILL ADDRESS FLOOD HAZARDS BY ADDING BANK PROTECTION TO THE ROAD AND BANKS NEAR AMO FALLS PARK STREET, SGT E CRUZ STREET. ACCORDING TO A STUDY BY THE USACE, THE AMO RIVER IS ABLE TO CONTAIN THE 100-YEAR FLOOD EVENT WITHOUT INUNDATING RESIDENTIAL HOMES. HOWEVER, A SITE VISIT IDENTIFIED OVERLAND RUNOFF AS A SOURCE OF EROSIVE FLOWS ACROSS THE AMO FALLS PARK STREET SGT. E. CRUZ STREET. THE SOURCE OF EROSIVE FLOWS ALONG THIS ROAD ARE TWO SMALL, UNNAMED TRIBUTARIES THAT ENTER AMO RIVER BY EITHER CROSSING UNDERNEATH THE ROAD THROUGH A SMALL CULVERT OR BY OVERTOPPING THE ROAD. DEBRIS AND SEDIMENT CAUSE OBSTRUCTIONS THAT REDUCE THE CULVERTS CAPACITY. TO ADDRESS FLOOD RISKS AND BUILD RESILIENCY IN THESE VILLAGES, THE GOVERNMENT OF GUAM WILL WORK WITH THE U.S. ARMY CORPS OF ENGINEERS AND CONTRACTORS IN THE IMPLEMENTATION OF THE UMATAC RIVER MAINTENANCE AND BANK STABILIZATION AND THE AMO RIVER FLOOD CONTROL AND BANK STABILIZATION PROJECTS. THE EXPECTED OUTCOMES OF THE MITIGATION PROJECTS ARE REDUCED RUNOFF AND LITTLE TO NO EROSION FROM STABILIZED RIVERBANKS. A CONTRACTOR OR CONTRACTORS WILL BE HIRED FOR THE IMPLEMENTATION OF ACTIVITIES TO CONTROL FLOOD HAZARDS AT THE UMATAC BRIDGE AND THE AMO AREAS. THESE ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE BUT ARE NOT LIMITED TO PRE-STORM CLEANING OF THE UMATAC BRIDGE, REPURPOSING DREDGE MATERIAL, RIVERBANK STABILIZATION, INSTALLATION OF RIPRAP ON THE BANKS, AND ROAD PROTECTION.

GRANT AWARD FUNDING WILL AVAIL THE VILLAGE OF HGATA, SURROUNDING AREAS VILLAGES, AND THEISLAND OF GUAM WITH VIABLE SOLUTIONS TO MITIGATE FLOODING, AND REDUCE FLOOD DAMAGEDURING INCLEMENT WEATHER AND ANNUAL STORMS IN HGATA. ADDITIONALLY, THE VILLAGE OFHGATA SERVES AS THE MAIN AND QUICKEST THOROUGHFARE TO CRITICAL LOCATIONS SUCH AS THE PORTAUTHORITY OF GUAM, THE GUAM POWER AUTHORITY, AND NAVAL BASE GUAM VIA MARINE CORPSDRIVE. DURING TIMES OF CRISIS CAUSED BY OR EXACERBATED BY STORMS, FLOOD MITIGATION MAYSIGNIFICANTLY REDUCE ROADWAY OBSTRUCTIONS FOR FIRST RESPONDERS THAT IMPEDE THEIR ABILITY TOPROVIDE LIFESAVING SERVICES AND OR TROUBLESHOOTING ASSISTANCE.THE STUDY WILL BECOME THE FRAMEWORK TO SELECT THE MOST SUITABLE IMPLEMENT THAT WILLMITIGATE FLOODING, REDUCE FLOOD DAMAGE, AND SAFEGUARD INVESTMENTS.

STATEMENT OF NEED AND BACKGROUND THIS DEPARTMENT OF INTERIOR AWARD WILL SUPPORT PARTICIPANT TRAVEL FOR 17 PARTICIPANTS FROM THE US PACIFIC ISLAND TERRITORIES AND FREELY ASSOCIATED STATES  GUAM, THE COMMONWEALTH OF THE NORTHERN MARIANA ISLANDS, AMERICAN SAMOA, REPUBLIC OF THE MARSHALL ISLANDS, FEDERATED STATES OF MICRONESIA  TO PALAU FOR THE FIRST PACIFIC ECOLOGICAL SECURITY CONFERENCE  PESC  3 5 OCTOBER, 2022  THE PESC WILL BRING TOGETHER PACIFIC ISLAND LEADERS, DEVELOPMENT PARTNERS, REGIONAL ORGANIZATIONS, AGRICULTURAL FOOD SECURITY AND NATURAL RESOURCE MANAGERS, AND MEDIA REPRESENTATIVES TO DISCUSS THE IMPORTANCE OF MANAGING AND PREVENTING THE SPREAD OF INVASIVE SPECIES IN PACIFIC ISLAND ENVIRONMENTS ECOSYSTEM SUSTAINABILITY, FOOD AND WATER SECURITY, AND CLIMATE CHANGE RESILIENCE IN PACIFIC ISLANDS ARE THREATENED BY THE IMPACTS OF INVASIVE SPECIES  INVASIVE SPECIES POSE CRITICAL CHALLENGES TO THE UNIQUE AND FRAGILE ISLAND LANDSCAPES, MARINE RESOURCES, BIODIVERSITY, AND HABITATS, LEADING TO SPECIES EXTINCTIONS AND FOOD INSECURITY  THE GROWING PREVALENCE OF INVASIVE SPECIES IS NOT JUST AN ENVIRONMENTAL THREAT, HOWEVER, BUT AN ECONOMIC ONE THAT JEOPARDIZES ISLAND LIVELIHOODS AND SUSTAINABLE DEVELOPMENT  THEY ALSO UNDERMINE PACIFIC AGRICULTURAL PRACTICES AND FOOD SECURITY, INCLUDING THE ABILITY TO RETAIN CULTURAL FOOD TRADITIONS  LASTLY, SECOND ONLY TO CLIMATE CHANGE, NO OTHER ISSUE SO DIRECTLY THREATENS PACIFIC ISLANDS THAN INVASIVE SPECIES  THEY WEAKEN THE RESILIENCE OF ECOSYSTEMS TO COPE WITH THE IMPACTS OF CLIMATE CHANGE, AS WELL AS THE ABILITY TO ADAPT TO A WARMING WORLD  FOR THESE REASONS, THE OVERARCHING GOAL OF THE PESC IS TO MAINTAIN AND PROMOTE PACIFIC ISLANDS ENVIRONMENTAL RESILIENCE, ENHANCE FOOD AND WATER SECURITY, LIVELIHOODS, AND CULTURAL RESOURCES, AND PROTECT BIODIVERSITY AND QUALITY OF LIFE THROUGH INVASIVE SPECIES PREVENTION, CONTROL, AND ERADICATION DETAILED DESCRIPTION THIS AWARD WILL ALLOW THE EAST WEST CENTER TO OFFER INVITED PARTICIPANT TRAVEL TO THE PESC TO 17 LEADERS AND INVASIVE SPECIES EXPERTS FROM THE JURISDICTIONS OF GUAM, THE COMMONWEALTH OF THE NORTHERN MARIANA ISLANDS, AMERICAN SAMOA, REPUBLIC OF THE MARSHALL ISLANDS, FEDERATED STATES OF MICRONESIA  THE PESC IS AN IN PERSON EVENT TO BE HELD IN KOROR, PALAU FROM 3 5 OCTOBER, 2022  HOSTED BY THE GOVERNMENT OF PALAU MINISTRY OF AGRICULTURE, FISHERIES, AND ENVIRONMENT, THE PESC IS SPONSORED BY THE PACIFIC COMMUNITY, THE EAST WEST CENTER, AND THE NATURE CONSERVANCY  CONFERENCE ATTENDEES WILL BE MADE UP OF GLOBAL AND PACIFIC ISLAND COUNTRY EXPERTS AND PARTNERS, AND THIS AWARD WILL ENSURE THAT THE US PACIFIC ISLAND TERRITORIES AND FREELY ASSOCIATED STATES ARE WELL REPRESENTED PESC PARTICIPANTS WILL DEVELOP PACIFIC WIDE STRATEGIC ACTION PLANS FOR HIGH PRIORITY TARGET PEST SPECIES, ARRIVAL AND DISTRIBUTION PATHWAYS, AND BIOCONTROL OBJECTIVES  PLANS WILL BUILD CONSENSUS ON BEST MANAGEMENT PRACTICES, AND ENHANCE OVERALL COORDINATION BETWEEN PACIFIC ISLAND COUNTRIES AND TERRITORIES, REGIONAL ENTITIES AND RESEARCH AND FUNDING PARTNERS AROUND IDENTIFIED GAPS AND NEEDS  IMPLEMENTING INTERNATIONAL, COORDINATED BIOSECURITY MEASURES IN THE PACIFIC REGION WILL STRENGTHEN EXISTING COLLABORATIONS WITH REGIONAL AND INTERNATIONAL INSTITUTIONS  INVASION RISK AND VULNERABILITY ASSESSMENTS WILL IDENTIFY HIGH PRIORITY AREAS FOR PREVENTION AND CONTROL ACTIVITIES RELATED TO THE PRIORITY SPECIES  THE EXPECTED OUTCOME OF THE PESC AND SUBSEQUENT COORDINATING ACTIVITIES WILL BE A  WHOLE OF PACIFIC  APPROACH TO ADDRESSING CRITICAL CONCERNS ABOUT INVASIVE SPECIES SPREAD AND MANAGEMENT  COLLABORATIVE RESEARCH EFFORTS WOULD ALSO LEVERAGE THE EXPERTISE AND RESOURCES OF THE MAINLAND UNITED STATES, AUSTRALIA, NEW ZEALAND, AND FRANCE

THIS PROJECT SUPPORTS THE PROCUREMENT OF RESOURCES AND EVIDENCE-BASED TRAINING FOR PHYSICAL EDUCATION FOR PUBLIC SCHOOLS IN PALAU. PALAU MOE WILL COLLABORATE WITH THE UNIVERSITY OF GUAM (UOG), WHO HAS BEEN PROVIDING TRAINING IN SPARK (SPORTS, PLAY, AND ACTIVE RECREATION FOR KIDS) CURRICULUM TO GUAM'S PUBLIC AND PRIVATE SCHOOLS FOR SEVERAL YEARS. UOG HAS APPLIED AND PROCURED GRANTS TO FILL THIS GAP ON GUAM, HAS TRAINED HUNDREDS OF TEACHERS, AND HAS PROVIDED HUNDREDS OF THOUSANDS OF DOLLARS OF CURRICULUM AND EQUIPMENT TO LOCAL GUAM SCHOOLS. IN ADDITION,THE SPARK CURRICULUM IS A RESEARCH-BASED PROGRAM OF SAN DIEGO STATE UNIVERSITY RESEARCH FOUNDATION DEDICATED TO CREATING, IMPLEMENTING, AND EVALUATING PROGRAMS THAT PROMOTE LIFELONG WELLNESS. SPARK STRIVES TO IMPROVE THE HEALTH OF CHILDREN, ADOLESCENTS, AND ADULTS BY DISSEMINATING EVIDENCE-BASED PROGRAMS TO TEACHERS AND RECREATION LEADERS SERVING PRE-K THROUGH 12TH GRADE STUDENTS (SPARKPE.ORG).PALAU MINISTRY OF EDUCATION WILL CONTRACT THE UNIVERSITY OF GUAM TO PROVIDE TRAINING TO 40 PALAU MOE TEACHERS-LEADERS. THESE TEACHER-LEADERS WILL THEN BE RESPONSIBLE FOR PROVIDING TRAINING AT THEIR RESPECTIVE SCHOOLS TO OTHER TEACHERS TO BUILD CAPACITY. PALAU MOE AND UOG WILL ALSO COLLABORATE ON CHOOSING AND PROCURING PE CURRICULUM AND EQUIPMENT. UOG WILL PROVIDE RECOMMENDATIONS BASED ON THEIR EXPERIENCE WITH GUAM'S EDUCATIONAL SYSTEM.

THE PALAU OFFICE OF PLANNING AND STATISTICS (OPS) CONDUCTED THE PREVIOUS HIES IN 2014, WITH 1,145HOUSEHOLDS BEING SELECTED IN THE SURVEY, OF WHICH 869 RESPONDED (76%) WITH SUFFICIENT DATA TO SIGNIFICANTLYCONTRIBUTE TO THE SURVEY ANALYSIS. THE 2014 PALAU HIES ADOPTED A NEWLY DEVELOPED STANDARDIZED HIESMETHODOLOGY FOR THE PACIFIC ISLANDS REGION WHICH RESULTED IN IMPROVED SURVEY FORMS BEING USED FOR DATACOLLECTION AND INVOLVED COLLECTING THE DATA OVER A 12-MONTH PERIOD TO ACCOUNT FOR SEASONAL CHANGES ININCOME AND EXPENDITURE PATTERNS, AND TO KEEP THE FIELD TEAM TO A SMALLER, BETTER QUALIFIED GROUP. THESECHANGES MADE DURING THE PREVIOUS HIES SHOULD HELP TOWARDS SEEING SIGNIFICANT IMPROVEMENTS IN DATAQUALITY FOR THIS UPCOMING HIES.THE HOUSEHOLD INCOME & EXPENDITURE SURVEY IS CRITICALLY NEEDED AT THIS TIME DUE TO THE IMPACTS OF THECOVID-19 GLOBAL PANDEMIC AS WELL AS OTHER FACTORS SUCH AS THE INCREASE IN OIL PRICES. THE HIES PROVIDES ASERIES OF CRITICAL STATISTICS ON IMPORTANT ELEMENTS OF THE ECONOMY. IT PROVIDES INFORMATION TO ESTABLISH THEWEIGHTS TO CONSTRUCT THE CONSUMER PRICE INDEX; IT PROVIDES ESTIMATES ON CONSUMER EXPENDITURE, A KEYCOMPONENT OF THE NATIONAL ACCOUNTS AND GROSS DOMESTIC EXPENDITURE (GDE). IT ALSO PROVIDES A GREATVARIETY OF INDICATORS ON REMITTANCE TO AND FROM PALAU, LIVING STANDARDS, ACCESS TO BASIC SERVICES, AND POVERTY,ALL OF WHICH ARE ALSO CRITICAL INFORMATION NEEDED TO INFORM THE DEVELOPMENT AND IMPLEMENTATION OF THESUSTAINABLE DEVELOPMENT GOALS (SDG) MONITORING AND EVALUATION FRAMEWORK.THE MAIN OBJECTIVES OF THE PROJECT AND THE SURVEY IS TO: REBASE THE CONSUMER PRICE INDEX BASKET; SUPPLEMENTDATA IN COMPILING COMPONENTS OF NATIONAL ACCOUNTS, BALANCE OF PAYMENT AND OTHER ECONOMIC INDICATORS; ANDENABLE FURTHER ANALYSIS OF POVERTY IN PALAU. ADDITIONALLY, THE SURVEY RESULTS PROVIDE USEFUL INFORMATION ANDINDICATORS ON THE SOCIOECONOMIC SITUATION OF PALAUAN HOUSEHOLDS. THIS INFORMATION WILL INFORMPOLICYMAKERS IN FRAMING SOCIAL DEVELOPMENTAL POLICIES AND IN INITIATING FINANCIAL MEASURES FOR IMPROVINGECONOMIC CONDITIONS OF PEOPLE.

ASTCA HAS 32 REMOTE LTE SITES THAT DO NOT HAVE ANY BACKUP AC POWER, OF THE 32 SITES, 10 OF THE SITES ARE FIRSTNET LTE SITES. THE SITES HAVE DC BATTERY BACKUP POWER, WITH BACKUP DURATION DEPENDING ON THE NUMBER OF RADIOS AND EQUIPMENT ON THE MONOPOLE. USUALLY THE BATTERIES WOULD PROVIDE BACKUP POWER VARYING FROM 15 TO 30 MINUTES; ANY PROLONGED OUTAGES WILL LEAVE RESIDENTS WITHOUT WIRELESS SERVICE FOR THE DURATION OF THE POWER OUTAGE. ASTCA DESIRES TO INSTALL SMALL 9KW RATED DUAL-FUEL STANDBY GENERATORS AND AUTO TRANSFER SWITCHES PER FIRSTNET REMOTE SITE, TO PROVIDE A MORE ROBUST BACKUP POWER SYSTEM, ESPECIALLY FOR THE REMOTE FIRSNET (FIRST RESPONDER) SITES. THESE SITES WOULD PROVIDE VITAL COMMUNICATIONS LINKS FOR FIRST RESPONDERS DURING TIMES OF DISASTERS.

THE OFFICE OF THE SECRETARY OF AMERICAN SAMOA (OSAS) IS CONSTITUTIONALLY TASKED AS THE REPOSITORY FOR ALL THE LAWS, RULES, AND EXECUTIVE ORDERS. THE LAST COMPILATION AND PUBLICATION OF THE LAWS AND RULES OF THE AMERICAN SAMOA GOVERNMENT WAS PUBLISHED IN 1990. BETWEEN 1990 AND 2022, AGENCY RULES WERE UPDATED IN SUCH A HAPHAZARD MANNER THAT A MAJORITY OF THOSE RULES HAVE YET TO BE FOUND WHICH HAS RESULTED IN AN UNORGANIZED, CONFUSING, OR CONFLICTING SCHEMA OF AGENCY RULES.IN 2019, THE RULE REFORM PROJECT WAS LAUNCHED VIA EXECUTIVE ORDER NO. 001-20191 WITH THE SIMPLE DIRECTIVE TO REFORM THE LOCAL RULES. A GRANT WAS SUBSEQUENTLY AWARDED TO FACILITATE THIS PROJECT (OIA GRANT NUMBER - D20AP00081).SUBSEQUENTLY, EXECUTIVE ORDER NO. 001-2021 MODIFIED THE ORIGINAL ORDER PLACING "ADMINISTRATIVE, LOGISTICAL, AND OPERATIONAL FUNCTIONS OF THE PANEL" UNDER THE LT. GOVERNOR IN HIS EX OFFICIO CAPACITY AS THE SECRETARY OF AMERICAN SAMOA OR HIS DESIGNEE.1 ADDITIONAL YET MINOR MODIFICATIONS TO THE MEMBERSHIP OF RULE REFORM PANEL WERE MADE WHILE RETAINING THE LETTER AND SPIRIT OF ITS RULE REFORM MANDATE.AT THE OUTSET, TWO DISTINCT ACTIONS WERE REQUIRED FOR THIS INITIATIVE: (1) ALL RULES NEEDED TO BE CONSOLIDATED, COMPILED, AND THEN PUBLISHED, AND (2) A COMPREHENSIVE REVIEW AND REVISION OF ALL THE CURRENT RULES WAS ALSO REQUIRED. SIGNIFICANT PROGRESS HAS BEEN MADE AND MUCH HAS BEEN ACHIEVED UTILIZING THE INITIAL FUNDS, HOWEVER, AS THE PROJECT PROGRESSED ADDITIONAL CONCERNS WERE IDENTIFIED THAT REQUIRED MODIFICATION TO OUR TIMELINE, GOALS, AND OBJECTIVES. FURTHER FUNDING IS REQUIRED TO COMPLETE THE PROJECT.

ENVIRONMENTAL REGULATIONS THAT ARE CONTEMPORARY IN CONTENT AND CONTEXT WITHCIRCUMSTANCES OF ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT ARE NECESSARY TO ADEQUATELY PROTECT PUBLICHEALTH, CONSERVE NATURAL AND CULTURAL RESOURCES FOR FUTURE GENERATIONS, AND ENSURE ASUSTAINABLE FUTURE. IMPROVED ENVIRONMENTAL REGULATORY SUFFICIENCY IS A MAJOR FACTOR TO HELPAMERICAN SAMOA MOVE TOWARDS FOOD AND WATER SECURITY AND PUBLIC HEALTH PROTECTIONUNDER THE ANTICIPATED IMPACTS OF CLIMATE CHANGE.AMERICAN SAMOA ENVIRONMENTAL REGULATIONS WERE FIRST PROMULGATED IN THE LATE-70S ANDEARLY-80S. SINCE THEN, REVISIONS AND UPDATES HAVE NOT BEEN CONSISTENT ACROSS ALLREGULATIONS, AND THERE HAVE BEEN NO DEVELOPMENT OF NEW REGULATIONS. SOME REGULATIONSSUCH AS THE WATER QUALITY STANDARDS HAVE RECEIVED TIMELY ATTENTION DUE TO FEDERAL CLEANWATER ACT REQUIREMENTS, WHILE WASTEWATER REGULATIONS HAVE YET TO BE PROMULGATED.AT THE TIME OF FIRST PROMULGATION, AND UP UNTIL C. 2000, THE MAJORITY OF AMERICAN SAMOAENVIRONMENTAL REGULATIONS SERVED ADEQUATELY. DURING THIS PERIOD THE POPULATION OF AMERICAN SAMOA REMAINED RELATIVELY STABLE (~55,000) AND ECONOMIC ACTIVITY REMAINEDMODEST. BEGINNING C. 2000, AMERICAN SAMOA INITIATED A MODERATE EXPANSION OF ITS TOURISTBASEDECONOMY AND AN INCREASE IN ECONOMIC ACTIVITY. THE EFFECTS OF CLIMATE CHANGE ALSOEMERGED DURING THIS PERIOD, WITH CHANGES IN TROPICAL CYCLONE ACTIVITY AND OTHER WEATHERPATTERNS SUCH AS RAINFALL. AMERICAN SAMOA FACES SOME OF THE GREATEST RATES OF RELATIVESEA LEVEL RISE IN THE WORLD (2021 COASTAL RESILIENCE ASSESSMENT FOR AMERICAN SAMOA BYNATIONAL FISH AND WILDLIFE FOUNDATION). CLIMATE CHANGE IS MOST DEMONSTRATED IN THE LOWLYINGCOASTAL SYSTEMS OF AMERICAN SAMOA WHERE NEARLY ALL OF THE POPULATION ANDCOMMERCIAL ACTIVITY OCCURS. PRESENT-DAY ECONOMIC ACTIVITY AND CLIMATE CHANGE EFFECTSCREATE DEVELOPMENT-RELATED STRESSORS THAT CHALLENGE THE CONTENT AND CONTEXT OF THEEXISTING ENVIRONMENTAL REGULATORY FRAMEWORK.REGULATIONS PROVIDE THE FUNDAMENTAL BASIS OF PRACTICAL GOVERNANCE FOR THE PRIVATE,COMMERCIAL, AND GOVERNMENT SECTORS. EXCEPT FOR THE WATER QUALITY STANDARDS (TITLE 24CHAPTER 2) THE MOST RECENT UPDATES FOR MOST OF THE AS-EPA ENVIRONMENTAL REGULATIONSWERE 20 OR MORE YEARS AGO . TO ADEQUATELY ADDRESS AMERICAN SAMOA'S PRESENTDAYECONOMIC CIRCUMSTANCES IN TERMS OF SUFFICIENT ENVIRONMENTAL MANAGEMENT, IT ISNECESSARY TO REVIEW, REVISE, AND MODERNIZE FIVE AS-EPA REGULATIONS AND DEVELOP ANDPROMULGATE WASTEWATER REGULATIONS.THE LONG-TERM GOAL OF THIS PROPOSED TWO YEAR AS-EPA INITIATIVE IS TO PROVIDE IMPROVEMENTS FOR FOOD AND WATER SECURITY AND PUBLIC HEALTH PROTECTION UNDER THE EXPECTEDCOMBINED IMPACTS OF CLIMATE CHANGE AND ENHANCED ECONOMIC ACTIVITY. CLEAN WATER ANDPROPERLY MANAGED WASTES ARE FUNDAMENTAL TO SOCIO-ECONOMIC WELL-BEING IN AMERICANSAMOA. REGULATORY SUFFICIENCY WILL PROTECT AMERICAN SAMOA'S SENSITIVE AND UNIQUENATURAL ENVIRONMENT AND CONTRIBUTE TO DEVELOPMENT OF A SUSTAINABLE TOURIST ECONOMY. ACONTEMPORARY ENVIRONMENTAL REGULATORY FRAMEWORK WILL CREATE A BUSINESS ENVIRONMENTTHAT WILL ATTRACT AND RETAIN PRIVATE AND COMMERCIAL SECTOR INVESTMENTS THAT ARE CONSISTENTWITH AMERICAN SAMOA'S SOCIO-ECONOMIC AND ENVIRONMENTAL VISIONS.

THE DEPARTMENT OF AGRICULTURE (DOA) IS REQUESTING FUNDING FROM THE MAINTENANCE ASSISTANCE PROGRAM OF THE U.S. DEPARTMENT OF INTERIOR TO PURCHASE SOIL AND RESIDUAL TESTING EQUIPMENT TO IDENTIFY NUTRIENT CONTENTS, COMPOSITIONS, AND OTHER CHARACTERISTICS THAT IMPACT PRODUCTIVITY IN FARMLANDS IN AMERICAN SAMOA.THE PROJECT GOALS ARE TO: (1) PROCURE NEEDED TESTING EQUIPMENT AND KITS TO CONDUCT SOIL AND RESIDUAL TESTING WITHIN A YEAR; (2) PROCURE A DATABASE FOR DATA COMPILATION, STORAGE AND ANALYSIS TO ASSIST AMERICAN SAMOA WITH FORECAST GROWTH AND POTENTIAL TOXICITIES.THE DEPARTMENT OF AGRICULTURE IS COMMITTED TO PROMOTING, PROTECTING AND SUSTAINING AGRICULTURAL PRODUCTION THROUGH UTILIZATION OF MODERN TECHNOLOGY WHICH ARE CULTURALLY ACCEPTED AND ENVIRONMENTALLY SOUND TO ACHIEVE A LEVEL OF SELF-SUFFICIENCY IN FOOD PRODUCTION AND SAFETY AND AT THE SAME TIME CONSERVE RESOURCES. THE OBLIGATION OF THE DEPARTMENT OF AGRICULTURE IS TO SUPPORT LOCAL FARMERS AND TO ENSURE THE SAFETY, SECURITY AND SUITABILITY OF PRODUCE FIT FOR CONSUMPTION BY THE PEOPLE OF AMERICAN SAMOA. DOA HAS BEEN PROACTIVE IN ESTABLISHING A DEPARTMENT-WIDE VISION AND STRATEGY FOR THE IMPLEMENTATION OF BEST PRACTICES AND NEW TECHNOLOGIES AND METHODS TO IMPROVE AND MAINTAIN HEALTHY PRODUCE YIELDS. THE AMERICAN SAMOA DEPARTMENT OF AGRICULTURE HAVE RECENTLY REVIVED THE LOCAL FARMER'S FAIR, ATTRACTING OVER 80+ LOCAL FARMERS AND GROWERS. IT IS THE GOAL OF THE DOA TO INCREASE AMERICAN SAMOA'S RESILIENCE BY ENSURING THE SAFETY AND SECURITY OF ITS AGRICULTURAL INFRASTRUCTURE BY HAVING AVAILABLE DATA AND INFORMATION THAT SUPPORT QUALITY PRODUCE AS WELL AS ADDRESSING ANY ENVIRONMENTAL CONTAMINANTS WHICH GIVES CONSUMERS HEALTH, SAFETY AND CLEANLINESS CONCERNS.

THE AMERICAN SAMOA COMMUNITY COLLEGE (ASCC) SUCCESSFULLY COMPLETED THE UPGRADE OF ITS SERVER AND SOFTWARE SYSTEMS IN ORDER TO PROVIDE MODERN TOOLS AND SERVICES TO ITS USERS. THIS ALLOWED ASCC TO RESOLVE ISSUES WITH CONNECTIVITY AND BEING ABLE TO PROVIDE OPTIMAL SERVICES AS WELL AS RESOLVE PREVIOUS AUDIT FINDINGS AND ALSO PREVIOUS MAJOR SYSTEM ISSUES THAT KEPT SERVICES FROM BEING PROVIDED EFFICIENTLY AND ON TIME.ONE OF THE MAJOR AUDIT FINDINGS THAT ASCC HAS NOT BEEN ABLE TO RESOLVE IS A WEAKNESS IN PREVENTING AND RESPONDING TO ATTACKS, INTRUSIONS, OR OTHER SYSTEM FAILURES. THE PURPOSE OF THIS PROPOSAL IS TO REQUEST ASSISTANCE FOR ASCC IN THE DEVELOPMENT OF A DISASTER RECOVERY PLAN THAT INCLUDES EQUIPMENT TO REPLICATE SERVICES AT AN OFF-SITE LOCATION. THIS WILL ENSURE THAT ASCC CAN RECOVERY QUICKLY FROM ATTACKS, INTRUSIONS, OR OTHER SYSTEM FAILURE. WITH THE RECENT COVID-19 SHUTDOWN IN AMERICAN SAMOA, AND THE MOVE TO PROVIDE MANY SERVICES ONLINE, IT IS MOST IMPORTANT NOW MORE THAN EVER THAT ASCC PROTECTS AGAINST ONLINE THREATS AND HAVE THE ABILITY TO RECOVER DATA.ASCC ALSO HAS A FAILING GENERATOR SYSTEM THAT IS MORE THAN 10 YEARS OLD. THE FAILURE OF THE GENERATOR SYSTEM TO AUTOMATICALLY SWITCH ON HAS CAUSED MULTIPLE SYSTEM FAILURES AND LOSS OF DATA. FAILURE OF OUTDATED UNINTERRUPTIBLE POWER SUPPLY (UPS) AS WELL AS NETWORK SWITCH UNITS ALSO CONTRIBUTE TO SYSTEM FAILURES AND LOSS OF DATA. FOR THIS REASON, A BACKUP GENERATOR AND NEW UPS UNITS IS INCLUDED AS PART OF THIS PROPOSAL TO ENSURE THAT ASCC ELIMINATE THE LOSS OF POWER AND CONNECTIVITY TO SIGNIFICANT SYSTEMS IN THE CURRENT NETWORK OPERATIONS CENTER (NOC) AND THROUGHOUT THE CAMPUS THAT NEED TO RUN UNINTERRUPTED.PROJECT DESCRIPTION:THE PROJECT IS BROKEN INTO TWO FUNDING PHASES OR ACTIVITIES THAT WILL ADDRESS THE COMPLETION OF A DISASTER RECOVERY PLAN. THE PHASES/ACTIVITIES ARE AS FOLLOWS:1) OFF-SITE DATA BACKUP2) BACKUP GENERATOR AND UPS UNITS

WITH THE INCREASED INTEREST IN TECHNICAL VOCATIONAL EDUCATION, THERE IS A NEED TO EXPAND THE CSD COURSES AND PROGRAMS, THE NEED FOR THE LATEST COMPUTER DESKTOPS AND INSTRUCTIONAL EQUIPMENT, THE LATEST COMPUTER LEARNING SOFTWARE AND ANTIVIRAL PROGRAMS, AND A SAFE WORKING ENVIRONMENT. OVER TEN YEARS, THE CSD NEEDS TO UPDATE ALL ITS PROGRAMS AND REPLACE ALL DESKTOPS AND INSTRUCTIONAL EQUIPMENT. THE MAJOR PROBLEM KEEPING CSD FROM ADVANCEMENT IS REPLACING ALL THE COMPUTER LABS WITH NEW UP-TO-DATE COMPUTERS AND INTERNET ELECTRONIC EQUIPMENT TO EQUIP STUDENTS WITH THE NECESSARY COMPUTER LITERACY SKILLSET REQUIRED IN THE EVER-CHANGING WORK ENVIRONMENT.THE ASCC COMPUTER SCIENCE DEPARTMENT IS A VITAL NECESSITY FOR THE FUTURE GENERATIONS OF AMERICAN SAMOA WHO HAVE LITTLE OR NO KNOWLEDGE AND EXPERIENCE TO ENTRY-LEVEL COMPUTER TECHNOLOGY SKILLS. RECEIVING THIS TAP GRANT WOULD INCREASE THE POSITIVE IMPACT OF THE EMPLOYABLE STATUS OF THE CURRENT AND FUTURE WORKFORCE. THE 2022 TAP GRANT WOULD SUBSTANTIALLY UPGRADE THE ASCC CSD CENTERS AND LEARNING LABS. THE PLAN WILL REPLACE OLD COMPUTERS AND ELECTRONIC INSTRUCTIONAL EQUIPMENT, INSTALL NEW ELECTRONIC SOFTWARE PROGRAMS, AND INSTALL INTERNAL INTERNET CABLE ACCESS TO CSD. AT PRESENT, CSD SHARES ACCESS WITH THE ASCC ADMINISTRATION AND THE 26 ASCC ACADEMIC DEGREE PROGRAMS.

PROJECT TITLE: GUAM UAV/UAS PUBLIC SAFETY ACQUISITION TO ENHANCE FIELD OPERATIONSTHE GUAM BUREAU OF STATISTICS AND PLANS (BSP) IS SUBMITTING A PROJECT PROPOSAL FOR FUNDING CONSIDERATION UNDER THE FISCAL YEAR 2022 TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE PROGRAM (TAP), CFDA 15.875, ECONOMIC, SOCIAL, POLITICAL DEVELOPMENT OF THE TERRITORIES THROUGH THE U.S. DEPARTMENT OF INTERIOR, OFFICE OF INSULAR AFFAIRS, ENTITLED "GUAM UAV/UAS PUBLIC SAFETY ACQUISITION TO ENHANCE FIELD OPERATIONS". THE TOTAL GRANT PROPOSAL AMOUNT IS $178,750.THE FUNDING REQUESTS IN THIS PROPOSAL WILL MODERNIZE THE GUAM FIRE DEPARTMENT'S AND THE GUAM POLICE DEPARTMENT'S FIELD OPERATIONS WITH EMERGING DRONE TECHNOLOGY THAT WILL ALLOW FOR BETTER PLANNING, DEVELOP BETTER STRATEGIES, INCREASE RESPONSE TIME, ENHANCE PREPAREDNESS, AND IDENTIFY HAZARDOUS SITUATIONS IN THE ENVIRONMENT. MORE SPECIFICALLY, IT WILL ENHANCE ENFORCEMENT EFFORTS SUCH AS ACCIDENT RECONSTRUCTION, SURVEILLANCE, MAPPING AND CRIME SCENE ANALYSIS AND ENHANCE EMERGENCY RESPONSE TO ACCIDENTS OR DISASTERS BY PROVIDING AERIAL PERSPECTIVE ON WILDLAND FIRES, SEARCH AND RESCUE EFFORTS, DISASTER AREAS, AND HAZARDOUS MATERIALS TO NAME A FEW.THE GRANT PROPOSAL WILL CAPITALIZE ON IN-HOUSE CAPABILITIES OF CERTIFIED DRONE OPERATORS WITH THE GUAM POLICE DEPARTMENT AND THE GUAM FIRE DEPARTMENT WITH THE PURCHASE OF TWO UNMANNED AERIAL VEHICLES (UAV) AND UNMANNED AERIAL SYSTEMS (UAS) TO RESPOND EFFICIENTLY AND EFFECTIVELY TO PUBLIC EMERGENCIES AND CONDUCT SAFETY OPERATIONS.THIS PROPOSED PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE FOLLOWING TAP PRIORITIES - PUBLIC SAFETY/EMERGENCIES, DISASTER PLANNING AND CAPACITY BUILDING. THE TWO UNMANNED AERIAL VEHICLES (UAV) AND UNMANNED AERIAL SYSTEMS (UAS) WILL BE PROCURED THROUGH THE GOVERNMENT OF GUAM PROCUREMENT PROCEDURES THROUGH AN INVITATION FOR BID AND FOLLOWING THE 2 CFR 200 REQUIREMENTS.AS BOTH THE GUAM FIRE AND POLICE DEPARTMENT TRANSCEND INTO THE 21ST CENTURY, THEY ARE EXPECTED TO ASSESS, ADAPT AND ADDRESS THE COMMUNITY'S NEED FOR IMPROVED SERVICES IN FIRE AND POLICE OPERATIONS AND DEVELOP PLANS AND PROGRAMS THAT WILL EFFICIENTLY AND EFFECTIVELY MEET THOSE REQUIREMENTS. UTILIZING THIS EMERGING TECHNOLOGY WILL FUNDAMENTALLY CHANGE HOW THEY OPERATE AND HOW IT WOULD ALLOW FOR GROUNDBREAKING WORK TO BE DONE SAFELY, EFFICIENTLY AND BETTER.

THE MARINE RESOURCES EDUCATION PROJECT ADDRESSES THE CRITICAL NEED FOR TEACHER TRAINING IN GUAM. THIS PROJECT WILL SUPPORT A COURSE FOR TEACHERS ON DEVELOPING PLACE-BASED LESSONS ANDRESOURCES (VIDEOS) ON GUAM'S MARINE RESOURCES AND DISSEMINATION TO ADDITIONAL TEACHERS AND STUDENTS. THE DIRECT IMPACT OF THIS PROJECT IS FOR 40 TEACHERS AND APPROXIMATELY 800 STUDENTS, WITH ADDITIONAL IMPACT AND SUSTAINABILITY BUILT INTO THE PROJECT.

GUAM COMMUNITY COLLEGE GRANT WRITING, FUND DEVELOPMENT, AND FINANCIAL MANAGEMENTGUAM COMMUNITY COLLEGE INTENDS TO BUILD GRANT WRITING AND FINANCIAL MANAGEMENT CAPACITY AT THE COLLEGE AND PROVIDE TRAINING FOR GOVERNMENT OF GUAM AGENCIES' AND LOCAL NONPROFIT ORGANIZATIONS' EMPLOYEES.GCC'S CONTINUING EDUCATION AND WORKFORCE DEVELOPMENT (CEWD) HAS PROVEN THAT IT CAN TRAIN ADULTS WHO NEED TRAINING AND CERTIFICATIONS TO GET BACK TO WORK AND HELP THE COMMUNITY RECOVER FROM THE ECONOMIC SHOCK CAUSED BY THE GLOBAL PANDEMIC AND GUAM'S LOSS OF ITS TOURISM ECONOMY. CEWD WILL CONTINUE TO MAKE A DIFFERENCE BY OFFERING BEGINNING AND INTERMEDIATE LEVELS OF GRANT WRITING TRAINING TO 40 INDIVIDUALS FROM THE GOVERNMENT OF GUAM AND THE LOCAL NONPROFIT COMMUNITY. HELPING THESE ENTITIES ACCESS MORE GRANT WRITING TRAINING WILL ASSIST WITH THE ECONOMIC RECOVERY BY POSITIONING THEM TO OBTAIN MORE MATERIAL RESOURCES THROUGH GRANT FUNDING. ADDITIONALLY, CEWD WILL OFFER 80 HOURS OF FINANCIAL MANAGEMENT TRAINING FOR LOCAL NONPROFITS THROUGH WORKSHOPS DESIGNED TO ASSIST NONPROFIT LEADERS AND FINANCIAL MANAGERS WITH MANY ASPECTS OF NONPROFIT FINANCIAL MANAGEMENT TRAINING.THIS TRAINING WILL ASSIST GCC AND THE PUBLIC SECTOR WITH ECONOMIC RECOVERY AND DELIVERING THEIR SERVICES. GCC MAKES A DIFFERENCE IN THE LOCAL ECONOMY BY DEVELOPING THE WORKFORCE NEEDED BY LOCAL EMPLOYERS.

SINCE 2016, THE ASSOCIATION OF STATE & TERRITORIAL HEALTH OFFICIALS (ASTHO) HAS ENGAGED WITH THE GUAM DEPARTMENT OF PUBLIC HEALTH AND SOCIAL SERVICES (DPHSS) TO CONDUCT STRATEGIC PLANNING AND BUSINESS PROCESS IMPROVEMENT ACTIVITIES. ALTHOUGH PRODUCTIVE, THE IMPACT OF THESE EFFORTS WERE LIMITED BECAUSE ADMINISTRATIVE AGENCIES WERE NOT ACTIVELY INCLUDED. HOWEVER, CHANGES IN GUBERNATORIAL AND DPHSS LEADERSHIP HAVE NOW BROUGHT ABOUT RENEWED INTEREST IN ENGAGING TOP EXECUTIVE LEADERSHIP AND ADMINISTRATIVE AGENCIES IN THESE EFFORTS TO EFFECT REAL AND LASTING CHANGE. RECENT CROSS-AGENCY DISCUSSIONS AND KEY INFORMANT INTERVIEWS HAVE VALIDATED THAT GUAM IS READY TO IMPROVE KEY BUSINESS PROCESSES. ASTHO AND GOVGUAM STAFF IDENTIFIED OPPORTUNITIES, READINESS, AND COMMITMENT TO ADDRESS LONG STANDING CHALLENGES WITH BUSINESS PROCESSES ACROSS GOVGUAM TO EFFICIENTLY RECRUIT, ONBOARD, AND PROCURE NECESSARY RESOURCES TO SUPPORT HEALTH IMPROVEMENT. DPHSS LEADERSHIP AND THE GOVERNOR SPECIFICALLY EXPRESSED INTEREST IN APPROACHES ASTHO IS FACILITATING IN THE US VIRGIN ISLANDS, WORKING WITH PROGRAMMATIC AND ADMINISTRATIVE AGENCIES TO EFFECT CHANGE.THIS REQUEST FOR $500,000 IS TO SUPPORT WORK FROM AUGUST 1, 2022 - JULY 31, 2023, AND SPECIFICALLY BUILDS ON TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE AND AN ASSESSMENT ASTHO CONDUCTED VIRTUALLY AND IN GUAM FROM DECEMBER 2021 THROUGH MARCH 2022 TO DETERMINE ROOT CAUSES AND READINESS FOR A CROSS-AGENCY INTENSIVE PROCESS IMPROVEMENT PROJECT AND IMPLEMENT STRATEGIES TO SUPPORT GUAM DPHSS' CENTRALIZED GRANTS MANAGEMENT OFFICE. THESE ACTIVITIES ALSO BUILD CAPACITY FOR CONTINUOUS IMPROVEMENT AND CONTRIBUTE TO SUSTAINABILITY OF IMPROVEMENTS. THIS FUNDING WILL ALLOW ASTHO TO ENGAGE KEY ADMINISTRATIVE AGENCIES INCLUDING THE DEPARTMENT OF ADMINISTRATION, OFFICE OF THE ATTORNEY GENERAL, BUREAU OF BUDGET MANAGEMENT AND RESEARCH, DEPARTMENT OF PUBLIC HEALTH AND SOCIAL SERVICES, AND THE OFFICE OF THE GOVERNOR IN IMPROVING PROCUREMENT AND RECRUITMENT PROCESSES THROUGHOUT GOVGUAM.

THE CHAMORRO LAND TRUST COMMISSION (CL TC) IS SEEKING TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE PROGRAM {TAP) 2022 FUNDS THROUGH THE DEPARTMENT OF INTERIOR'S OFFICE OF INSULAR AFFAIRS UNDER OIAOIA-TAP2200038 FOR THE ENHANCEMENT OF THE CLTC'S INFORMATION TECHNOLOGY INFRASTRUCTURE TO IMPROVE ITS PROCESS. CLTC WAS ESTABLISHED THROUGH PUBLIC LAW 12-226 TO SERVE AS THE ADMINISTRATOR OF ALL GOVERNMENT OF GUAM LANDS THAT HAS ASSUMED THE STATUS OF CHAMORRO LAND TRUST PROPERTY. TAP FUNDS WILL BE USED FOR THE SCANNING AND DIGITIZATION OF EXISTING RECORDS, DEVELOPMENT OF A USER INTERFACE WEB-BASED DATA SYSTEM SOFTWARE, AND THE DESIGN AND DEVELOPMENT OF CL TC'S WEBSITE THAT WILL IMPROVE ITS PROCESSES TO PROMOTE AN EFFICIENT AND SECURE SYSTEM TO SERVICE THE GENERAL PUBLIC, GOVERNMENT, PRIVATE, AND MORE IMPORTANTLY, CHAMORRO LAND TRUST PROPERTY OWNERS AND LESSEES.TO DATE, THE CLTC HAS NOT BEEN ABLE TO ESTABLISH ITS OWN DEDICATED SYSTEM AND NETWORK INFRASTRUCTURE, EXPAND ITS SERVER AND STORAGE CAPACITY, TO INTRODUCE ENHANCED INFORMATION TECHNOLOGY EQUIPMENT TO PROVIDE A SECURE, EFFICIENT AND TIMELY SERVICES TO CL TC CONSTITUENTS, THE GENERAL PUBLIC, GOVERNMENT AGENCIES, AND THE PRIVATE SECTOR. THE CL TC WAS ESTABLISHED AS AN INDEPENDENT AGENCY THROUGH GOVERNOR OF GUAM LOURDES A. LEON GUERRERO'S EXECUTIVE ORDER IN 2019. PRIOR TO THE EXECUTIVE ORDER, CLTC WAS A DIVISION UNDER THE GUAM DEPARTMENT OF LAND MANAGEMENT (OLM) AND OPERATED UNDER DLM'S SYSTEM TO PROCESS AND PROTECT CONSTITUENTS SENSITIVE AND PERSONAL DATA USED BY CL TC PROCESSES.THE CLTC'S LONG-TERM GOAL IS TO IMPROVE ITS ORGANIZATIONAL CAPACITY TO MEET THE NEEDS OF THE POPULATION SERVED. THE SCANNING DIGITIZATION OF APPROXIMATELY 750,000 FILES WILL PRESERVE LAND FILES AND THUS PROTECT THE INTEREST OF THE CONSTITUENTS. DIGITIZATION WILL ALSO ELIMINATE THE NEED FOR STAFF RESOURCES TO MANUALLY LOCATE AND SCAN FILES. THE CODING/INDEXING OF FILES WILL ALLOW FOR QUICK ACCESS AND RESPONSE TO CONSTITUENT REQUESTS PROVIDING FOR AN EFFICIENT, EFFECTIVE AND TIMELY MANNER TO MEET THE NEEDS OF CLIENTS AND MEET THE MISSION. HAVING A DEDICATED WEBSITE FOR CL TC WILL ESTABLISH ITS PRESENCE AS AN INDEPENDENT AGENCY AND WILL PROVIDE FOR GREATER TRANSPARENCY OF ACTIVITIES. TRAINING ON UPLOADING AND MAKING BASIC CHANGES TO WEBSITE WILL ALLOW FOR CAPACITY BUILDING AMONG STAFF. THE WEB-BASED USER INTERFACE DATA SYSTEM SOFTWARE WILL PROVIDE FOR A HIGHLY INTUITIVE AND SECURED SYSTEM THAT WILL BE INTEGRATED WITH CLTC'S WEBSITE AND WILL STREAMLINE CLTC'S WORKTLOW AND MANAGE THE DOCUMENT DATABASE. THE SCANNING, DIGITIZATION, WEB-BASED USER INTERFACE DATA SYSTEM SOFTWARE, AND THE WEBSITE WILL INCREASE EFFICIENCY AND EFFECTIVENESS BY REPLACING OUTDATED METHODS OF MANUAL APPLICATIONS AND PROCESSING COUPLED WITH THE MANUAL OPERATIONAL PAPER RECORDKEEPING AND RETENTION WITH INNOVATE TECHNOLOGY TO ACHIEVE HIGHER RETURN OF INVESTMENT. THE OVERALL OUTCOME IS TO NOT ONLY IMPROVE EFFICIENCY INTERNALLY BUT TO IMPROVE SERVICE DELIVERY TO THE PUBLIC.

TRAINING ON UPLOADING AND MAKING BASIC CHANGES TO WEBSITE WILL ALLOW FOR CAPACITY BUILDING AMONG STAFF. THE WEB-BASED USER INTERFACE DATA SYSTEM SOFTWARE WILL PROVIDE FOR A HIGHLY INTUITIVE AND SECURED SYSTEM THAT WILL BE INTEGRATED WITH GALC'S WEBSITE AND WILL STREAMLINE GALC'S WORKFLOW AND MANAGE THE DOCUMENT DATABASE. THE SCANNING, DIGITIZATION, WEB-BASED USER INTERFACE DATA SYSTEM SOFTWARE, AND THE WEBSITE WILL INCREASE EFFICIENCY AND EFFECTIVENESS BY REPLACING OUTDATED METHODS OF MANUAL APPLICATIONS AND PROCESSING COUPLED WITH THE MANUAL OPERATIONAL PAPER RECORDKEEPING AND RETENTION WITH INNOVATE TECHNOLOGY TO ACHIEVE HIGHER RETURN OF INVESTMENT. THE OVERALL OUTCOME IS TO NOT ONLY IMPROVE EFFICIENCY INTERNALLY BUT TO IMPROVE SERVICE DELIVERY TO THE PUBLIC.

THIS AWARD WILL ALLOW THE OFFICE OF THE LIEUTENANT GOVERNOR OF GUAM (THE OFFICE) TO CONTRACT FOR A GRANTS MANAGEMENT CAPACITY BUILDING AND ENHANCED GRANT PERFORMANCE TRAINING. THE PRIMARY GOAL, IF AWARDED IS TO INCREASE THE GOVERNMENT OF GUAM'S GRANT MANAGEMENT CAPACITY, ENHANCE THE TERRITORY'S MANAGEMENT CAPABILITIES, AND STRENGTHEN ITS PERFORMANCE WITH TWO PRIMARY GOALS: 1) TO ADDRESS THE SYSTEMIC AND PERSISTENT GRANT MANAGEMENT CHALLENGES AND 2) TO ENHANCE GRANT PERFORMANCE WHICH WILL SUPPORT TO THE GOVERNMENT OF GUAM'S ACCOUNTABILITY AND FINANCIAL MANAGEMENT OF FEDERAL PROGRAMS. AS A RESULT OF THE RECENT COVID-19 PANDEMIC, THE TERRITORY IS RECEIVING AN UNPRECEDENTLY LEVEL OF GRANT FUNDING TO SUPPORT FEDERAL PROGRAMS. THIS ONCE IN A GENERATION FUNDING INCREASE HAS HIGHLIGHTED THE TERRITORY'S CRITICAL NEED FOR GRANT MANAGEMENT CAPACITY BUILDING AND ENHANCING ITS GRANT PERFORMANCE. THE GOVERNOR AND LIEUTENANT GOVERNOR ARE KEENLY AWARE THAT RESOURCES ARE VERY LIMITED OR SCARCE ACROSS ALL SOURCES; INCLUSIVE OF OTHER FEDERAL AGENCIES AND DEPARTMENTS. ACCORDINGLY, THE GOVERNOR AND LIEUTENANT GOVERNOR STRONGLY BELIEVE THAT IMPROVING GRANT MANAGEMENT AND GRANT PERFORMANCE WILL ENHANCE GUAM'S ABILITY TO EFFECTIVELY LEVERAGE THESE SCARCE RESOURCES WHEN MANAGING FEDERAL PROGRAMS. THE ENHANCEMENT OF GRANTS MANAGEMENT WILL PRODUCE OUTCOMES THAT ARE MORE SIGNIFICANT AND TANGIBLE FOR ALL STAKEHOLDERS, INCLUSIVE OF THE DEPARTMENT OF THE INTERIOR.MANDATORY COURSE CONTENT SHALL INCLUDE: INTRODUCTION TO GRANTS AND COOPERATIVE AGREEMENTS, MONITORING GRANTS AND COOPERATIVE AGREEMENTS, 2 CFR 200, UNIFORM ADMINISTRATIVE REQUIREMENTS (SUBPARTS A-D AND E), COST PRINCIPLES FOR FEDERAL AWARDS.OTHER RECOMMENDED COURSE CONTENT CAN BE: INDIRECT COST RATES, BUSINESS MANAGEMENT SYSTEMS FOR GRANT RECIPIENTS, PROCURING GOOD AND SERVICES UNDER FEDERAL GRANTS, CLOSEOUT OF GRANTS FOR FEDERAL EMPLOYEES, WRITING SUCCESSFUL FEDERAL GRANT APPLICATIONS WORKSHOP.

THE MICRONESIAN RESOURCE CENTER ONE-STOP SHOP (MRCOSS) HAS QUICKLY BECOME GUAM'SPREMIER RESOURCE TO ASSIST COMPACT OF FREE ASSOCIATION (COFA) MIGRANTS AS THEY TRANSITION TO LIFEON GUAM. MULTI-LINGUAL CASEWORKERS, ALSO KNOWN AS CULTURAL MEDIATORS, ASSIST CLIENTS NAVIGATETHEIR NEW HOME BY PROVIDING ONE-TO-ONE CASE MANAGEMENT SERVICES, EDUCATIONAL AND INFORMATIONALWORKSHOPS, AND OTHER SUPPORT SERVICES AT THE PROJECT'S OFFICE AND IN THE COMMUNITY THROUGH ITSMOBILE OFFICE. THROUGHOUT ITS 6 YEARS, THE PROJECT ATTRIBUTES MUCH OF ITS SUCCESS NOT ONLY TO ITSGRASSROOTS APPROACH OF HELPING THE COFA COMMUNITY, BUT ALSO TO NUMEROUS PARTNERSHIPS THAT HAVELED TO THE STREAMLINING OF PROCESSES AND SHARING OF RESOURCES.IN 2020 AND 2021, DEMAND FOR THE PROJECT'S CULTURALLY AND LINGUISTICALLY APPROPRIATE SERVICESINCREASED, AS A CONSTANT STREAM OF INFORMATION ABOUT COVID-19 SAFETY PROTOCOLS, GOVERNMENTREGULATIONS AND EMERGING PUBLIC ASSISTANCE PROGRAMS WERE ANNOUNCED. MANY GOVERNMENTAGENCIES AND NONPROFIT ORGANIZATIONS TURNED TO THE PROJECT FOR ASSISTANCE IN TRANSLATING ESSENTIALINFORMATION TO HELP INDIVIDUALS AND FAMILIES UNDERSTAND HOW TO STAY SAFE, EVERCHANGINGGOVERNMENT REGULATIONS AND NEW PROGRAMS. ADDITIONALLY, THE PROJECT SAW AN INCREASE IN DEMANDFOR SERVICES FROM CLIENTS OVER THE PREVIOUS TWO YEARS, ACCOUNTING FOR 41% OF THE PROJECT'S TOTALCLIENT INTAKE. CASEWORKERS ASSISTED A STEADY STREAM OF NEW AND EXISTING CLIENTS NAVIGATE EMERGINGPANDEMIC ASSISTANCE PROGRAMS, OBTAIN IDENTIFICATION DOCUMENTS, AND CONNECT WITH OTHER RESOURCES.ALONG WITH ONE-TO-ONE CASE MANAGEMENT, THE PROJECT CONTINUED TO DO OUTREACH THROUGH THEDISTRIBUTION OF MEALS AND FOOD COMMODITIES, DISSEMINATION OF INFORMATION, COVID-19 TESTINGDRIVES, AND EVENTUALLY COVID-19 VACCINATION EVENTS.AS THE WORLD CONTINUES TO MOVE TOWARDS RECOVERY FROM THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC, MRCOSSREMAINS COMMITTED TO ASSISTING COFA MIGRANTS FIND SUCCESS IN THEIR NEW HOMELAND. THE PROJECTPROPOSES TO CONTINUE OPERATIONS WITH ITS EXPANDED TEAM TO: 1. PROVIDE CULTURALLY AND LINGUISTICALLYAPPROPRIATE ONE-TO-ONE CASE MANAGEMENT TO ASSIST CLIENTS NAVIGATE GOVERNMENT ANDNONGOVERNMENT PROGRAMS; 2. CONDUCT EDUCATIONAL AND INFORMATIONAL WORKSHOPS TO ASSIST CLIENTSLEARN ABOUT LOCAL LAWS, CUSTOMS, AND RESOURCES IN THEIR NEW HOMELAND, DEVELOP SKILLS TO ASSIST THEMIN BECOMING GAINFULLY EMPLOYED, AND ESTABLISH PARENTING TECHNIQUES TO HELP THEIR CHILDREN THRIVE;3. CONDUCT WEEKLY COMMUNITY OUTREACH IN MULTIPLE COMMUNITIES CONNECTING INDIVIDUALS ANDFAMILIES IN NEED OF ASSISTANCE AND EXPERIENCING BARRIERS TO ESSENTIAL SERVICES AND RESOURCES; 4.PROVIDE TRANSLATED INFORMATION AND CONDUCT VIRTUAL VILLAGE MEETINGS TO KEEP COFA FAMILIESCONNECTED WITH UPDATED NEWS AND PROGRAMS; 5. COLLABORATE WITH PARTNERS THROUGH STAKEHOLDER'SFORUMS AND FORMAL PARTNERSHIPS; AND 6. PROVIDE YOUTH EMPOWERMENT OPPORTUNITIES THROUGHOUTREACH ACTIVITIES AND A YOUTH INTERNSHIP OPPORTUNITY. ADDITIONALLY, THE PROJECT WILL CONTINUE TOMONITOR AND EVALUATE ITS PROCESSES AND SERVICES TO ENSURE CLIENTS ARE ASSISTED EFFICIENTLY ANDEXPEDITIOUSLY.

FISCAL YEAR 2022 CAPITAL IMPROVEMENT PROJECT  CIP  PROGRAM  THIS AWARD PROVIDES  2,000,000 IN FEDERAL FUNDING TO THE U S  VIRGIN ISLANDS, DEPARTMENT OF PUBLIC WORKS, ESTATE THOMAS ROAD IMPROVEMENTS PROJECT

STATEMENT OF NEED AND AGENCY BACKGROUNDTHIS DEPARTMENT OF THE INTERIOR GRANT WILL HELP TO FACILITATE THE 2022 TERRITORIAL CLIMATE AND INFRASTRUCTURE WORKSHOP. THE INTENDED USE FOR THE GRANT IS IDENTIFIED AS A PROJECT TO FACILITATE THE IN PERSON ATTENDANCE OF TERRITORIAL PARTNERS. THE BUREAU OF BUDGET AND MANAGEMENT RESEARCH (BBMR) AIMS TO PROVIDE GUIDELINES ON ORGANIZATIONAL METHODS, POLICY, EXECUTION, FINANCIAL MANAGEMENT, AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE TO THE VARIOUS AGENCIES AND DEPARTMENTS WITHIN THE GOVERNMENT OF GUAM AND ACROSS ALL OUTLYING TERRITORIES.DETAILED PROJECT DESCRIPTIONTHIS AWARD WILL ALLOW THE OFFICE OF THE GOVERNOR OF GUAM, THROUGH BBMR, TO FACILITATE THE IN PERSON ATTENDANCE OF ITS TERRITORIAL PARTNERS AT THE 2022 TERRITORIAL CLIMATE AND INFRASTRUCTURE WORKSHOP IN HONOLULU, HAWAII ON MARCH 27 THROUGH MARCH 30, 2022. THIS WORKSHOP IS ESSENTIAL TO CARRY ON THE MOMENTUM AS A RESULT OF THE INTERAGENCY GROUP ON INSULAR AREAS (IGIA) 2022 PLENARY MEETING. PURSUANT TO EXECUTIVE ORDER 13537, THE IGIA SHALL SOLICIT INFORMATION AND ADVICE FROM THE ELECTED LEADERS OF THE U.S. INSULAR AREAS OF GUAM, AMERICAN SAMOA, THE UNITED STATES VIRGIN ISLANDS (USVI) AND THE COMMONWEALTH OF THE NORTHERN MARIANA ISLANDS (CNMI) AND MAKE RECOMMENDATIONS TO THE PRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES ANNUALLY ON THE ESTABLISHMENT OR IMPLEMENTATION OF FEDERAL PROGRAMS CONCERNING THESE INSULAR AREAS.THE WORKSHOP WILL BE A HYBRID (IN-PERSON/VIRTUAL) WORKSHOP TO FURTHER EXPLORE TERRITORIAL INFRASTRUCTURE NEEDS. IT WILL RECONVENE TERRITORIAL OFFICIALS WITH PERTINENT FEDERAL AGENCY INFRASTRUCTURE PARTNERS TO FOCUS ON STRATEGIES TO SUPPORT THE SUCCESSFUL IMPLEMENTATION OF PROJECTS THAT CAN BE SUPPORTED BY THE BIPARTISAN INFRASTRUCTURE LAW (BIL). PROJECT TOPICS UNDER THE BIL INCLUDE WATER, BROADBAND, BUILT AND NATURAL INFRASTRUCTURE, ENERGY AND LEGACY POLLUTION.THE OFFICE OF THE GOVERNOR OF GUAM, THROUGH BBMR, WILL COORDINATE THE IN PERSON PARTICIPATION OF THE TERRITORIES AND WITH THIS AWARD, WILL PROVIDE THE TRAVEL AND PER DIEM COSTS ASSOCIATED WITH THIS WORKSHOP. TERRITORY DELEGATIONS ARE INCLUSIVE OF THE U.S. INSULAR AREAS OF GUAM, AMERICAN SAMOA, THE USVI AND THE CNMI. TOTAL COSTS INCLUSIVE OF ADMINISTRATIVE/CONTINGENCY IS $163,070.00
